1tsoIA1cntoofgwv0d7Efg.text: Teppanyaki grill is like sex... Even when it's bad, it's still good! Haha. Good food, pretty good service and was cheaper than most teppanyaki spots.

bb4KaUHAputOQh9w3VfGsg.text: Nice show,but I like my food to all come at once.I didn't like that the vegtables came out way before the meat was cooked??I think this type of food should all be cooked at the same time.The meat and vegtables were good,but the portions were small.   I think with a few upgrades this could be 5 stars.

-0E5BQn5sL7fMWgoMwGGDw.text: Went to ohjahs tonight. It was our first time there. Outside it smells AMAZING so you instantly float your way in. The lighting was perfect which set the mood. ff5JIAkdN6bNW1B-p8lXbA.text: I've been here for lunch and the food was good. Now the Hibatchi grill is something else. That food is amazing. Our cook could've been more flashy but the food was just delicious. The servers were great. Very attentive. Had a couple different kinds of sushi as well. All were great.

O8PXaOnxPu9pbgQ9QP3gTQ.text: Their teppanyaki is awesome and the service is good. Our chef was also very entertaining.

A12mdLJFrOLwlEoJ5LODDg.text: Yoooo! Ohjah gets a big fat noooojah from me! I wanted to order the hibachi steak with fried rice but i was informed you can only get hibachi steak at the hibachi grill side. Fair enough, i was seated at a table so i just ordered their dinner ny steak that came with all parts of a hibachi steak minus fried rice and minus the hibachi. What my server brought out( i dont know his name but he was asian and skinny, so ill call him Chad) was this abysmal excuse of a ny steak. It was thin as hell, like it just got done fasting for 48 hrs and THEN ran a marathon. The taste was non-existant. For $17, you would expect a decent steak, lets just say that memo was not given to ohjah. The meso soup that came with it was awful. The salad that came with it was very good because of their dressing. So if you want a tasty salad, try ohjah. But If you want a good steak come to my backyard and ill whip one up on the barbie! Nooojah is a no go but Chad was the shit!:)

39qfL0NUb58Ivfq4KlE0JA.text: Came in last minute and they accommodated us at a hibachi table. Food was good. Service and chef were great. A little can be said about the cleanliness.  Under the table was dirty but despite that we enjoyed our time. We will probably come back

dNrgH-cX1dcLDz_zJusDkg.text: I missed my hibachi back home and my fiance and I decided to try this one because it was close to the same prices.    Wow...talk about an improvement.  The food was fantastic and I'm completely in love with the soup that comes with the hibachi meals.  The salads were good, I'm not a huge fan of the dressing but my fiance enjoyed it (it's the first time I've ever seen him devour a bowl of salad like it was the main course).  The fried rice was fantastic, as were the chicken and beef that we got.  The couple seated next to us had lobster and scallops and they both said they'd come back just to get those again.    If I had to criticize anything, it would be that the veggies were a little bit too soft for my liking.  They didn't have as much flavor to them as the rest of the meal did.    On the way out, we were told "Thank you, we hope to see you again" or some varient of at least six times.  Talk about feeling like a valued customer.

jntIKFv5oxTADk-q38XlHA.text: Not impressed with the chef! Threw pepper in my drink. Not very personable. Food was good.

Jsy4w3UF4P5975F9UPxaIw.text: Not a good experience tonight. Usually everything is great but tonight was pretty bad. We took our friends and their 11-year-old son for the first time to experience the restaurant.  Our chef was very nice but was boring. He did the volcano trick and the eggroll trick but that was it. Our friends son was really looking forward to the shrimp tossing but we never got it. Also, my husband ordered the Seabass and it was absolutely disgusting!!! It was a very bad piece of fish that smelled AWFUL!!!! He didn't eat it. And when we let the chef know, he said he would let the manager know. But then we had a remind the waitress, who came back and took it off the bill. But he was never asked if he was still hungry or wanted anything else. They brought out the check and were never offered dessert. Looking forward to the Pecos and windmill restaurant opening up. We'll be back, because we've always had a good time here.

kxW2lTd12vrhkfqA7VfVnQ.text: Ohjah is the perfect sushi spot for us in the southwest. They have a great selection of rolls and lots of options for those who prefer their meals fish free. The main dining room is always fairly quiet and dark which sets up for a nice little romantic dinner. I prefer to go a little bit later to miss the crowd. We haven't had their hibachi yet but we have been dying to try because every time we're there, it sounds like they're having a great time!

nONSJfPTnwarVRTfH3oUEw.text: My uncle picked this up to go for my mom and i. We really enjoyed the sashimi plate of 20 pieces. All of the pieces were very think and very fresh. The fish practically just melted in my mouth. The 20 pieces were not enough for all three of us, so we ended up going back and getting two rolls, Ohjah roll and the Las Vegas roll. I would definitely say stick with the sashimi. I will come back when I'm back in town most definitely

CW_RaXvMct3tMyoN09nBZw.text: I went here to serve my friends from Japan. The food was really good, and the service was beyond my expectation. Great place! I would definitely go back there for another round of sushi!

npNI9lWe0AbVLIzNRemyLw.text: The sushi rolls here are to die for, so elegantly decorated and every bite wants to you to have more. I thought cream cheese in the middle was a bit odd but now "Dark Cycle" is my favorite roll. The ambiance was great and they had a large TV to watch last nights NBA game which was nice. The reason why I'm giving a 4 star is b/c of the service. Our waitress had to be called over four times to get more water, the check, etc. We even had to get a different guy to get some of those things. I would definitely come back with my handy groupon.

AnQAn2gRGO7wvkPsWffxNg.text: Great food and fun atmosphere. My husband and I actually love this place and think the price is reasonable. The reason for my three star instead of five star rating is because of the "extra charges" they put on our last bill. We spent almost $200 on food, so to be charged for something like refills on the iced tea was very annoying! We were celebrating a birthday and anniversary, we asked the waitress if they would sing happy birthday. They sang and brought out a small piece of cheesecake, then charged us for the cheesecake! I have never been charged for a "birthday" dessert! I'm sorry but if I just spent almost $200 on food the least you could do is throw in the slice of birthday cake. I really like this place but charging us for those silly things will make me think twice about going there next time. In fact, the next time I have a craving I will try the hibachi place closer to my house.

KYqViLJ7fU9xxd2t3lahKg.text: This place is in our neighborhood and is very delcious! They have a special it's buy 2 rolls get one free! Rocky is so funny and nice he's one of the guys who creates the delicious rolls! Whenever I need a quick bite I come here!

sCiOUxup-TuZWXkY8stUIw.text: This has been my spot for years. They are so friendly. The food is super good, they cook it in front of you. And the sushi is to die for. And an amazing variety of sake. Try this place out. It's great, and not to expensive.

keZ_fRqme_7WXCWzAE8spQ.text: My family and I love this place. The prices are great and the food is amazing. My son has food allergies and they always make sure to take care of him when we go. The cooks are entertaining and the wait staff is very courteous and attentive. 2 thumbs up :)

Zo8SUHg8Pcdog8tDlyO-Yg.text: This is one of our favorite places!  The atmosphere is casual and there is a wide variety of items to choose from.   Kid friendly as well as a great place for an adult dinner. The prices are very reasonable and you get plenty of food.  The seafood is as good as their steak and I highly recommend this restaurant and location!

wvCpgIeycKD_HqgtXVm_3g.text: Great food good ambiance. Will definitely be back when I'm craving habachi & sushi rolls!!! I had the Blue Diamond sushi combo my husband had the hibachi combo with steak, scallop & shrimp. Our friends had Kobe beef and everything was great but $48 on top of the $8.95 is pretty stiff especially when the Kobe was such a thin slice! All n all it was pretty good!

R38uc3qnyKMlQY1tNrwHEg.text: This was my first experience at a Hibachi restaurant. Loved it, super good. You get a salad and soup with your meal and it's perfect.  Chef Ken was our chef he was fun and very nice.  My only tiny complaint was that I should have ordered another protein, the amount of shrimp you get isn't a lot. EhBwrAUR-tZaWcTd0eN1jg.text: I'm crazy about hibachi lol.  This was our first experience at a hibachi grill, out chef was perfect he was funny and experience he delivered a great show and had us very entertained. Food was great to, I loved the salmon which I normally don't like, the chow main was delicious and those veggies cooked perfectly. Also the restaurant has a great atmosphere, it's very clean and roomie.

ZEeCRlc679cSmjlFHxtihw.text: We decided to try this place for my husband birthday. We are so happy for our experience. I ask for scallops it was so good! Shrimp are huge! They give you free dessert for birthday! Definitely will coming back! Highly recommended this place!!!

JX-RIVMT6JCMEliGaGrpDQ.text: I had heard a lot of good things about Ohjah an wanted to try it for my birthday. We had made an appointment for a regular table but changed it to the hibachi when we got there. They were nice and were able to fit us into a table.    The chef we got was really good at cooking, but he had ZERO interaction with our table at all. He went through the motions and while it was all very impressive, he never smiled or laughed or acknowledged us. It was a bit strange.    The food was delicious!  We shared the Hibachi combo, with one basic to share, and it was the perfect amount. The scallops were cooked perfectly, as was the steak and shrimp.  I really wanted the oysters on the half shell or oyster shooters, but they didn't have any so ended up getting a "screaming orgasm" and that was okay. It was a very small portion compared to other places.   When most everyone at our table was done eating, the servers seemed in a rush to get us out, but we wanted to linger and try some dessert and drink more wine. It was a bit uncomfortable. They kept bringing our check and we kept asking for more things so they'd have to take it back. We were the only ones left at the table and I felt bad - I wanted to ask if we could move to a normal table since we weren't ready to leave yet, but the server told us we were fine, even though they kept bringing us our check lol.    All in all, the food was great, the service was fast, and it was a great birthday dinner.

71HL1ZaBiEwSeIasnpmXPw.text: I didn't get the young lady's name the last time I was here but I saw her today and had to shout her out!  Her name is Alice and she is really friendly.  I pretty much got the same thing except this time I asked for extra garlic for the fried rice and veggies.  The vegetables were cooked just right--flavorful and delicious.    Maybe it was my driving, maybe not, but half of the rolls came apart by the time I got home but that didn't affect the taste one bit :)  If you are vegan be sure to ask for the ginger dressing with the salad.  I forgot this time and ended up with the mayo-based dressing.    Still good service.  Didn't have to wait long.

PU9TTIF_zJM-rP6Zh8FKRw.text: Always a favorite! Was a little bummed when we ran about 15 mins past our reservation and they could no longer seat us at a Hibachi Table. So we sat at a booth on the restaurant side. As we were about to place our order, a guy, maybe the manager, came over and said there was an opening for our party at a Hibachi table. We were so happy, and immediately got up and moved! The service was very good, quick and polite. They turned those tables around so quickly. The chief was very entertaining. And the food is always really good, and made to order right in front of you. Always a fun time!! Will be back for sure! Highly recommend this location!!

2FoBm27LD9JAXDTaGWlJGQ.text: This place is a go to spot for many of my friends and I. 3$ SAKE BOMBS?!? We are broke college students and can get drunk for a low price?? Count is in! Of course they card and make sure we are of age, but they keep the drinks coming! The food is always so great and stays consistent in taste and quality. I've been here at least 10 times for birthdays or just to dinner with my boyfriend and always had a great experience. You choose from a variety of entrees (I always enjoy the hibachi experience) which then comes with a salad, soup and veggies. After the food and a decent amount of drinks you can leave here with a 40$ tab which isn't bad at all. The hibachi chef's and servers are always friendly and keeping our water filled, plates cleared and drinks on deck. They serve sushi here as well, and usually perform some type of show for the hibachi experience. They toss veggies or extras left over from cooking into everyone's mouths and you catch it, which who doesn't want to see their friends get hit in the face with food? Lol. Great restaurant and fun place for a night out or special celebration. Request Jason as your server, although he is usually at the Durango location! He is the man (:

Qzc8JrHbhNRzxNixdvoZDA.text: Went here for date night & were pleasantly surprised! Who knew that this hidden gem was right here in this little strip mall. Awesome food & show at the hibachi. Everything was so fresh & flavorful......we will definitely be back. Prices were very reasonable & a great value for the money.

IOEA4o6yLQ-P2TVKzKFNMw.text: The food here is awesome, our favorite chef is parisceth, he is funny and the food is always phenomenal. We are weekly customers!

I thought it was undercooked so I told the cook he put it back on the flatiron he did for a whole 2 min I tasted it again the chicken was clearly bad it was literally like rubber we could not even bite it. I talked to our waitress she was like well I'll remove the chicken but I have to charge you for the noodles I'm thinking wow what customer service. OLRLX_LE8yJ-9ntVrUkdTQ.text: Better than the Osaka, Hamada, or Benihana at much more affordable price.  Nothing fancy, but a neighborhood Hibachi/Sushi restaurant shouldn't be overly fancy or overly priced.  The sushi is good, and the 23.95 for any 3 specialty sushi items make it even tastier.   Definitely worth a trip if you are considering eating Hibachi anywhere in Las Vegas.

7b_hz2Ldsya0afAkYfaihA.text: One of my favorite sushi restaurants! The food is great, prices are fair and the service is always on.  Chef David at the sushi bar is amazing! He is very creative and always has a smile. The sushi is always fresh and never disappoints. They have Sapporo and Kirin on tap, which is a nice compliment to the fresh sushi. They also have a habachi room that puts on a great show, fills you up and is very reasonably priced (the fried rice in there is awesome!).

aoUFgaTL45jvoKjYVt3A_w.text: Ninja roll is amazing. So is their tuna tataki. I have never been disappointed at this location.

BnjWw45eubG9U_AuIqx78w.text: I give this two stars because our experience was horrible. We were a table of 8. We all ordered together and the server brought my friends food when the rest of us were done! When approaching the manager he just said it's coming it's coming. Horrible experience and the sushi wasn't even that good either.

65-SUG-2Oe7kWXVDi7BNOQ.text: This place is divided into two different Japanese restaurants, you can dine on the tappanyaki side or the regular menu side. Both are very delicious. There are so many tappanyaki restaurant and Ohjah has the best. The price is reasonable and the food is very good quality. The chefs are super fun and they definitely bring their unique tricks to grill. As for the regular menu side, it's a little more pricy but the food does not disappoint. I wish they offered All You Can Eat sushi, but they don't so getting the sushi platter or sushi boat would be the next best option. I love their sashimi and nigiri because their fish is really fresh. However, if someone your party doesn't eat sushi, they may not enjoy the selection on the regular menu and it would be more ideal to eat on the tappanyaki side of the restaurant. Lastly, I would have to say that the service is a little better on the regular menu side than the tappayaki side. It seems as though the waiters are a little slower and distracted on the tappayaki side. But on the regular menu side, I have to give two thumbs up to the waiters. Often times you order sushi at restaurants and there seems to be a language barrier or something, but here at Ohjah they usually understand what you're ordering and they rarely get orders wrong. I give the waiters a lot of credit for knowing their menu well.

BZViByvw4L7BRq8JaTxe-A.text: Not your authentic japanese food. Shrimp tempura crunch roll...not fresh and not good. Veggie fried rice was bland....who ever had the bright idea of throwing bean sprouts in them??? A bit too overpowering. Never order it again!!! Korean kalbee...very fatty. Service was fast but not attentive.  If I come back, which is slim to none...I think their hibachi food is what their known for.

WQ2bw3emDE6-t29dWsYpqg.text: Cook is awesome so is the food however the waiter was a joke!!! I am a regular every 3 weeks but after that customers service I will no lo get be a regular amazing! !

_uk5YTiI-Fo-V353AzWnjQ.text: Ohjah is always a great time. If you want to go on a date and liven it up a little then ohjah is the spot. I have the scallops, filet, and chicken. Everything was super tender and juicy.   I would recommend this spot for a local over a tourist though. It has a great atmosphere and can be a really good time. Chefs keep te table in a good mood!

ztv3Lryr2zxhngROVrRR_A.text: Oh man...great teppanyaki and at a great price! I came for dinner for Father's Day and tried out the teppanyaki. I love how they do their offerings. They separate the meats by section and individual price so that you can mix and match your plate however you want. I chose the NY strip steak and the shrimp. My sister tried the scallops and NY steak. MY father tried the sukiyaki beef and NY steak, and my brother in law tried the Salmon and chicken.   You start with the $8.95 basics which includes the the option of fried rice, steamed rice, or noodles, soup, and salad. This is MANDATORY for teppanyaki. Then you pick from the list of meats you'd like and you just mix and match. They also offer kobe beef at $50 and lobster tail also at $15. The dishes and offerings are typically what you'd expect for teppanyaki. Same quality and flavor. Next time I would love to try the filet minon instead as I wasn't too fond of the NY strip steak. It was tougher and less flavoring. The sukiyaki beef is A GOOD CHOICE. They're full of flavor, tender, and juicy!   Our chef was great, He was funny, and very patient with obnoxious children. So big ups to him. For a total of 4 people plus an order of a glass of reisling and tempura ice cream we spent a good $100.00. Woohoo! What a deal! That's compared to my tab at Musashi which was $160.00 for 2 people! Same quality of food. Same service. Cheaper price. Call me a fan! I'll be back soon!

iI5tcsFuY-vNgJsY2vgLgA.text: Ohjah is the type of place you feel compelled to open a Yelp account for just to tell people how much you love it.   By far the best hibachi in town. The prices are right, the service and cooks are awesome - genuinely nice people there.   On a couple occasions if we found ourselves waiting for a bit for a few other people to join our cooking area, they've offered a free appetizer or a free drink. Not sure if that is official policy but it definitely was nice.   The food is amazing. My girlfriend regularly gets the Salmon. I get Lobster and Filet.  Only have had a couple of the sushi rolls, mainly go there for hibachi, but they were great!  Always a fun atmosphere, always someone's birthday.   If they could fix ANYTHING it would be to get a better birthday song for their iPod. Man. It's bad. And you'll hear it 1-5 times during your visit.   Beyond that, excellent place. Absolutely try it.

grWVYKYiW25yWBt5D1tVWQ.text: We went here for late lunch. The hibachi lunch was delicious and very reasonably priced. It was empty when we got there so it felt a bit more intimate. The chef was skilled and had a likeable personality. The staff was also nice and went out of their way to chat us up when they found out we were local. I had the chicken and shrimp and my friend had beef and chicken. Along with that were the regular sides of fried rice and veggies (mushrooms, zucchini and onion). The meal also included miso soup and ginger dressing salad. Everything was delicious and reasonably priced. I plan on returning, but during off hours because it sounds like this place gets packed on weekend nights.

AWwLHVwPrhxx_ujJJ2ey4Q.text: Glad we tried this place, and it's right in our 'hood! Calamari tempura and filet mignon hibachi we're excellent!

pYj0X2QY_hmKg4_mG52r6Q.text: The entertainment was awesome with the chefs cooking in front of you. Flavor of the food honestly wasn't anything too special though. Definitely a fun atmosphere but wish the flavor was better.

NQPDOob4nCEgGqwQsPTf6A.text: Had to eat here twice to fully encompass the whole experience. The first visit was the plain old sushi lunch.  Food was good but nothing spectacular, but spicy tuna rolls, tempura, and edamame all seem to taste the same everywhere after 3 or 4 tall asahis.  Second time I came for the tepanyaki.  The chef was very polite and friendly.  Engaged us but wasn't intrusive in our dinner in any way.  Had the filet and shrimp (both cooked perfectly)  Overall this place is clean, food is above average compared to other sushi establishments, service is great, and it's up the street from where I lay my head.  Only reason I can't give 5 stars is I still have to pay for the food.

q7PZQ1vaIzmH3AhBSMUcoA.text: The hardest thing to achieve in a restaurant is consistency.  Often we go somewhere and LOVE it, then the next time its blah.  Not the case with Ohjah!  We go there about every 2 weeks and its ALWAYS AWESOME.   Sometimes the company is better than others,  some chefs are more skilled with the knives than others, but the FOOD is Always PERFECT.   You won't hear me say that too often, so trust me when I do.  The pricing of the menu is more competitive than other Japanese steak houses.  Its $8,95 base price for the rice veggies and soup, then you ad your meats.  We usually have the Filet Mignon plus either shrimp, scallops, chicken or halibut.  The filet is like meat flavored butter, melts in your mouth.   Actually I wish they used a little more butter in the prep, but its always flavorful and healthy.   We do usually get a tuna sashimi but I will say this.  the fish is fresh and yummy, BUT its cut in too large of chunks.  I prefer a smaller cut for a more delicate taste and feel.  We ate at the sushi bar once and all the fish was cut too large.   Nevertheless,  the The steakhouse, hibachi grill is the BEST in town for the BEST price.  I highly recommend it any day.

ZXyZlq9WEj-n9XVyOH-jnQ.text: My wife and I joined friends at Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse (Blue Diamond and Decatur) recently. I was a little hesitant about the restaurant choice because I've never had a taste for sushi, but the majority rules, so I agreed. It was the night before New Year's Eve, and the restaurant was pretty much filled. Chefs were putting on shows at many tables. Patrons were clearly enjoying themselves; the restaurant was buzzing with laughter and excited chatter. Our service started off a little slow, but soon we had our appetizers. Everyone in our group had sushi; mine, thankfully, was cooked. And it was very good! Between the delicious appetizers and the salad, I was enjoying myself in spite of my earlier reservations about going to a restaurant known for its sushi. I could have left at the point and been very satisfied.   But then the chef - I believe his name is Van - came over to our end of the table and started an amazing display of acrobatic and culinary showmanship that was a joy to watch. He introduced each element to us and was soon flipping things into the air and even flipped a cup into his hat all the while keeping a fast beat with his cooking tools. Fascinating to watch! The scallops and shrimp were excellent, and the vegetables were cooked and seasoned to perfection. But the standout was the steak. The most tender and flavorful steak I've had in years. Melt-in-your-mouth with no fat or waste at all. And we had more than enough to take home for leftovers.   We left late, and as the chef and then the waiter cleaned the table, we asked what they were cleaning with. Lemon juice, they said - no chemicals. That impressed us. And he said they would clean it again the next morning. Overall, we were very impressed. Delicious food, very clean restaurant (even the restrooms were immaculate), friendly service and a terrific show, too. The Ohjah at Blue Diamond and Decatur is definitely worth revisiting.

c7xJOdLwndLoxhbGBrCdzA.text: This is our go to place for sushi. Place is always neat and the servers are pleasant. I recommend you to try pink lady sushi. So delish!

G3baJZ-fi6--I6SEPJoYIQ.text: I've been here 3-4 times and have had fairly good experiences most of the time. Seen a couple of dirty forks that I've had swapped out but usually don't have complaints about the food.   This last experience is what dropped my rating. While eating I found hair in my rice. I showed it to the waitress and she was nice and apologetic. So was the chef. They asked if I wanted them to take my plate away.  She then offered to remake the dish. I told them yes but asked for it in a to-go container since the rest of my party would be finishing up by the time I got my food.   Throughout this process I was extremely polite and understanding. As gross as it is.. I understand that things happen. I received my to-go order and my bill... 100% of my bill. Due to the inconvenience of having to wait for my food I believe I should have received some sort of discount. I'm naturally passive but someone else in my party felt it was unacceptable and requested it on my behalf. The manager offered 10%.... $3 and some change.   When I got home and checked my order... the protein portions were incredibly tiny. Nothing close to what you would receive dining in. Tasted fine though and no stray hairs that I could find.   Just overall bad service recovery experience. Due to cleanliness concerns and this last experience I probably won't return.

HA6upQK5_ldPeyIzteg0Qw.text: Loved this place. The ambiance, the food, the staff. Everything was excellent.  We did a fire off of different meals at different times and shared them at the table. Mostly susho rolls, a couple of different appetizers, and dessert. The waitress was very accommodating and our food arrived in great timing.  Everything we had was fabulous. The Japanese tea we had to top off our meal was really impressive in both taste and presentation. Also tried a green tea cheesecake that was phenomenal.   We will definitely be back. I can't wait to try more items off the menu!

C5Zw54xtb3t19jjrkPIG2A.text: Ohjah is a hidden gem located in an indiscriminate plaza, the interior is elegantly designed and service was quick and efficient. The lobster roll is refreshing and savory. The killer bee roll was a little sweet for us, but was still good.

r0KkLg4gF3_-f6szc-DQqQ.text: This place will make you yell, "Ohjah!!!!!"  This is the best dinner show I have been to in Las Vegas. It's also the best value. Forget the Tournament of Champions or Blue Man Group, this is the place to be (and it's family friendly!). Have you ever seen someone throw an egg and crack on on the edge of a spatula without humpty dumptying it (it's a word)? What about lighting an onion volcano on fire with their finger? I have and it was awesome. Our Hibachi chef has been cooking Hibachi for years and it showed not only in the entertainment, but in the food.He was self deprecating and very funny, but more importantly the New York steak and filet were cooked perfectly. No, Seriously, melt in your mouth perfection. The chicken was also fantastic. We took our kids with us and he took the time to cook their portion of the steak slightly longer and cut the steak to the perfect size for even the tiniest of our enthusiastic eaters. We also had a killer waitress who kept our drinks topped off the entire time and was very sweet to our children.   I've done hibachi at many restaurants. This was by far my favorite hibachi experience ever. I would go back in a heartbeat.

CgQBVY7NC3kUwAy_Xp1GRA.text: This was our second time coming here. It was just as great this time as it was last time! Great food from their sushi to their teppan. The chef we had this time was really great, a younger guy with an amazing fire act, much better than most of the ordinary displays.

mfFaYCKTvxS8s1WLKQttqQ.text: Went for a friend's bday and it was amazing!!!!! The food, the service, the memories. Our chef was so personable and made the whole experience so fun! We took sake bombs and the teppanyaki chef, the host and the table next to us joined in! Stan was such an awesome host!! Always a smile on his face helping us out. Nothing bad at all to say about our first experience at this Ohjah. Best one!!!!!

dB8ITDmGxtwgH2Hqx27_lA.text: We came here with a crave for hibachi. We don't crave for hibachi very often but it happened to be one of those day, so we decided to give Ohjah a try.   We came here on a Sunday 6 pm but hibachi table was all full. Have to wait at least an hour. They do not serve hibachi food if you sit at regular table. So I highly recommend making a reservation or call ahead if you're going for hibachi.   The service was great, the manager was very friendly and polite explained to us about the wait. Our chef was also fun and engaging. We get to see lots of cool tricks as usual.   Food was just alright. The crave for hibachi is all about that buttery garlic soy sauce fried rice! But it was kind of tasteless and missing the rich butter and garlic taste. Disappoint.. but the shrimp and filet mignon was good. I recommend adding garlic butter with your steak - Yum!   Overall experience - not impressed. It's just what you can expect at an average hibachi restaurant. If we're craving for hibachi next time, we'll probably go for Benihana since now it's open in Vegas!

U_0SDY1J3krBQRawX3W-ng.text: Today was their grand opening day and I couldn't have been any more excited! I pass by this place everyday and was anxious to try this new restaurant on Decatur and Blue Diamond. On my way home from work, I saw their "Open" sign lit up so I called my husband right away and told him to meet me there for dinner.  We were greeted warmly when we walked in and were asked if we wanted to sit at the bar, a booth or if we wanted hibachi. We opted for hibachi. The hibachi room was huge and there were eight cooking stations.   My husband ordered the Special Rolls Combo for $23.95 and got the Dragon Roll, Spider Man Roll and Kamikaze. I ordered the Filet Mignon hibachi which came with vegetable teppanyaki, house salad, miso soup and your choice of fried rice, fried noodle or steamed rice for $16.50.  The sushi was pretty good... Normally my husband and I like raw fish but since I'm pregnant, he ordered all cooked rolls. I especially liked the Dragon Roll because the salmon was cooked with a nice charred taste. I think I may be used to AYCE sushi so I don't think I sushi would be my first choice when I come back.  I enjoyed my hibachi meal and our chef was entertaining. I watched three different hibachi chefs and it looked like they all had their own tricks up their sleeves. The house salad was good but they were a little too liberal with the dressing. I enjoyed the Filet Mignon very much because the meat was tender and flavorful and cooked to my preference.  I was too full to order dessert but I want to try the tempura ice cream next time. The only three dessert items are ice cream, mochi ice cream and tempura ice cream.  The service was top notch even though they had a lot of patrons. We were checked on regularly and we didn't have to wait long for our food or our check. The service was surprisingly good for a restaurant's opening day!    I will be back again since this place is super close to home. I'm so glad this place that I have been keeping tabs on is finally open! Ohjah was definitely worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special Rolls Combo (Dragon Roll, Spider Man Roll and Kamikaze)

7tocTHSRXt3KgMmXjbbHWA.text: This place is amazing. I have been to the 215 and Flamingo place and the menu is the same, interior very different here. The nigiri hamachi is melt-in-your-mouth fantastic. Excellent menu, fast friendly service. Reasonably priced drinks and appetizers. The sushi is fresh and delicious. The only drawback is it is not open until 3pm, I tried coming here for lunch on a Saturday and it was not open. But dinner is terrific, check this place out!!

qG10vHtee0_-lB6Xl6xKwQ.text: Been here several times already and I love the Sushi.  When I grow tired of the AYCE quality and I am craving some nice high quality Sushi this is my new haunt.  I can only comment on the Sushi Bar since I have not tried the Teppan. I am a Nigiri Sushi addict. I am a big fan of everything in the refrigerated case in font of me at this sushi bar. So if you ask me what I like, I can just point to the general area of the fish and say "all of that." The only thing that I have found that doesn't blow me away, and this is strictly a personal preference, was the cure on the Saba. Still better than many others though. The daily specials on the board are well worth the price and I have not been anything but satisfied with anything I have ordered from it. I usually order an appetizer, a meal, and whatever fancies me from the specials board and I am happy.  They have great deals to fit whatever mood you are in. The service is always friendly and attentive.  The restaurant is always clean. The last time I visited it sounded like a party in the Teppan area. I have to try that next visit.

tLYcdyAjeyMz6GUeDASS_A.text: My favorite local sushi spot! The steakhouse is excellent and very reasonably priced as well.

xm31qUcOkrAi9qXLsixn2A.text: We come here quite a bit, I would say once or twice a month. We used to frequent more often than now, so we hadn't been in some time, but I have been to this location well over fifteen times.  Let me start off by saying the food here is definitely good. I cannot comment on the sushi, as I have never had it but the hibachi is always solid. Tonight we went and things seemed weird.   It seems like Ohjah is getting cheap with their product. First, the chef told me he wasn't allowed to use extra garlic on my shrimp (or really use any garlic at all) because it is not procedure and he would get in trouble. Apparently management/ownership was getting annoyed with people asking for extra items and not paying. I would gladly pay for extra rice, veggie, etc. But garlic?! How expensive can a tablespoon of garlic really be. I would have paid for it had he said "garlic is extra" but he didn't; he just made it clear he wasn't allowed to use any garlic on ANY meat item other than steak..... Okay.   Second, I have never counted the shrimp I get on my plate, but I would say they used to give you 8-10 shrimp per order. Today I got 5. Once again, okay.   This was not the chefs fault by any means. I just feel as though ohjah is getting a little skimpy on their food. Hibachi is not cheap, so I will likely take my business elsewhere next time where they will gladly add garlic to my food.

9y4y3gzcdSui0WogrGhm6Q.text: The food is okay. I mean this wasn't our first choice everything was closed so it had to do lol. But it was extremely salty and okay sushi. I've had better

Good food and service with avg prices.   If your looking looking for a nice Japanese restaurant or a good Hibachi show this is the place to go. This is going to be a regular spot for us.

9DO8PqeZliqCD5d_ecaz3w.text: AMAZING!!!  Went with friends and the kids and my girlfriend couldn't get enough!!  Will DEFINITELY be back next time in Vegas!!

w1k-V0YlP_D_fO2Vis-ZGw.text: We decided to give this place another chance after a not so pleasant experience with one of the chefs last time. The owner was very understanding and set up a reservation for us to come back. We came for a late lunch around 3:30pm before the rush. The manager greeted and sat us on the hibachi side and the staff was very accommodating. We had Keith as our chef (aka "Hello Keithy" he said, which was pretty catchy) and he remembered us from a previous time. He's always very nice, friendly, and in a happy mood which is always a good sign. I do think that the staff's mood is a big part of setting a guest's experience. He was able to add extra garlic to my meal without acting like it was a hassle (which the previous chef was not happy about when I asked last time). My friend and I both had the shrimp and NY steak and it was very flavorful and well prepared. Next time I come in I'll definitely request Keith again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York steak with fried rice and veggies

t1MX38FSiMq53Op_g7_r1Q.text: My fiancee and I went in on a whim tonight for the hibachi side. It's pretty roomy inside and we got to a table where four friends were already at. Not too crowded, nice. The waitress came over right away, Fiona I believe, and she was very nice, attentive, and friendly. We never waited for anything. The chef came and he was AMAZING, older gentleman, Devon or David we believe we heard his name was, had 30 years under his belt and his skill showed that yet he still acted like it was just as fun as day 2. So funny and jokes were everywhere, such a good time. The manager was incredibly nice as well having come over to check on us after we were served food.   Really, no complaints. However, it is very different from other hibachi places we've been, taste wise. Different, not bad. And the prices were awesome, $40 for just the two of us. We'll definitely be back.

_U1tt1eNufL0hFKzxwealA.text: Great service. Very attentive staff.  Veggie egg rolls very tasty and it seems they give good attention to the main dishes.  Typical fare.  Warning:   The plum wine is VERY sweet....like Moscato on steroids - and I enjoy Moscato. Sure, I expected sweetness but had to dilute it with water and ice to drink it as I don't sip wine. Did I say VERY sweet...almost syrupy. Guess I should have known better...my bad.  Had the green tea ice cream. Will not try that again.  The "crust" in which the ice cream is wrapped was not to my taste so I mostly ate the green ice cream...not bad on it's own but not a fav.  Nonetheless, they pulled out 4 stars for an overall grade to be fair.  BTW...  It was March and they had a fully decorated and lit Christmas tree up.  Jokingly, ask the waitress about it and she had no idea other than to say "...no room to store it."  Now that was funny. The tree was right by our booth. Pleasantly unexpected.

6i_4wVpl4NazNO09NBp0Lw.text: Awesome, our family loves coming here. Our 2 year old enjoys the little show they put on and he eats well every time! They were very accommodating with my infant in the car seat. The fried rice is so yummy. Sashimi is awesome!   Minus 1 star because every time we come the server/host(ess) seems to always rush us in ordering our food. I understand there are other families in the group and of course we don't want to keep them waiting but both times, the others have barely ordered their appetizers and with two littles ones..we have to get ourselves situated and be able to read the menu while fighting with usual "kid" stuff at the table. This time, it seemed like she was already frustrated that we needed 5 minutes to decide what we wanted.   Anyway, we ordered 2 hibachi dinners, one with NY Steak & the other with Teriyaki Chicken, a Rainbow Roll, Calamari, 2 orders of Tuna Sashimi, a large Sapporo beer, and Apple juice = ~$90 with tip. Not bad - will definitely come again.

Not only did our waitress check back with us more than once, but the waiter and manager did as well. The lighting was great, music was at perfect level, and they were even showing The World Cup on TV. I am impressed with the entire experience. I highly recommend them. We got the lunch special that was actually a really good deal! This place doesn't do AYCE and most of the places we go to do. I can't remember the name of the roll I got, but it had a mango salsa on top. It paired really well!  I want to come back to this place for more sushi and to try the hibachi! My friends and I ordered their boat special- which was so filling we didn't even eat all the sushi.  You choose three different sushi rolls and it comes with sashimi as well for $45- which I think is cheap compared to other places.  Their Rock N Roll roll was a refreshing taste, it had salmon, tuna, avocado, and yellowtail wrapped in cucumber (a big roll but still tasty).  Their baked mussels are juicy and tender.  The service here is amazing. They're very attentive and always remember you whenever you visit :)

dDe7VA6ZpuDDG7ovZYQ6Tg.text: Tried this out after our favorite sushi place closed, and we were not disappointed. A lot of rolls to choose from, a nice atmosphere, and the staff was super friendly. Everything tasted fresh, and everything we tried was good. We'll definitely go back.

IFeuu-c7hgN-5CxdPnS-tQ.text: Love this place. We dine here about once a month or so. My little grandsons love the food and the chefs. Typical Tepanyaki, but always fun and the staff is friendly. They really make you feel like they are happy that you came in.

1cMFXCSpVFjea1b7bFsuxA.text: I don't think of hibachi places as big draws, especially for the foodie crowd. So, I was surprised to walk into Ohjah on a Friday night and see the place packed. It's also a sushi joint, but that side of the restaurant had a few open tables. The hibachi side was filled. That's impressive considering they had six cooking stations.  The basic hibachi dinner ($8.95) consists of standard fare -- vegetables, salad, soup, and fried or steamed rice or noodles. I added shrimp ($5.75) and a 5 oz. filet ($7.55) to the mix. The shrimp was pretty good and the filet was cooked medium rare, as ordered, and was tender, as expected.  The best way to judge any hibachi place, though, is the entertainment factor. Our chef -- an older guy -- was ok. He was friendly enough, but all the tricks he did were the same standard ones you see at any hibachi place -- tossing the egg shell in the hat, the onion volcano, etc. He also tossed shrimp to some of the guests (again, a standard hibachi trick) but only to the guys, which disappointed some of the women at the table.  If you like hibachi places, you'll like this. If you don't, you probably won't be a fan. While it's similar to many others I've been to, I'd recommend this place for a fun night out whether or not it's with a date or a family.

SqEgiUHSOoGMg0dcfVszxg.text: Love the atmosphere, love the staff and the chef who put on an adequate show with his cooking skills in front of the patrons.  For appetizers, ordered the seaweed salad which was on par with typical sushi spots.  Ordered the $48.95 dollar sushi boat + hibachi for our main entree. Presentation of the boat was good, except the sushi tasted just a-ok, nothing special compared to other sushi places we have gone to. The sashimi wasn't bad either, but didn't rise to the top. The tuna & salmon --- just okay.  The biggest upside is the hibachi. Having the chef cook in front of you never gets old to me. The hibachi basic + add-ons were all very tasty, although we noticed the cook did add A LOT of butter when he cooked.  Overall, you should have a good time here. But if you want better tasting sushi in Las Vegas, you're better off at Oyshi, Sushi Tower or Nobu (on the strip).

Hffm4iwUAEYxU1v06-bEbA.text: So it started off wrong...When we entered the Manager proceeded to tell us he would have a table for us in about 15 minutes and that the people are leaving but they keep talking and talking like they were getting on his nerves. OK! who tells that to customers? That's exactly what we plan to do (we had a party of four) we intended on enjoying the evening with dinner and drinks. Hellllo!! once we got to the table the plates were dirty we had to get them switched out. We order drinks and again my glass was extremely dirty. I ordered a long island ice tea but really it was a lemonade with a shot of rum WTF. So I got a new drink, this time it was a coke and rum. I just came to the conclusion that the bartender didn't know what the hell he was doing. I was tired of complaining and ordering the same drink with no results. I hope they get it together. The waitress was nice and patient and I understood that it was not her fault. The chef saved the day because he was fun and a great cook.

5FQdKAOfrBpM1VyAoZ5nBg.text: I have been here several times for hibachi dinner and I can tell you that your dining experience here will depend on which chef perform/cook your meal. One chef will give you a 5 stars experience while the other one will make you question yourself for why the hell you're spending a lot of money for a lousy meal.  My regular and favorite chef is the tall skinny (Viet) chef who always does an excellent job entertaining guests and also make a good meal. When you go to a hibachi dinner, you expect entertainment in addition to good food. As for the other chef who cooked one of my meals, granted he was very nice, he basically just focused on cooking the food and not very entertaining at all. Even worse, the food was salty and just overall not good.  Since you are sharing the hibachi cooking table with other guests, I'm not sure if you can choose which chef will cook your dinner. Due to this reason, I am now less likely to take my guests here for dinner, which is too bad since this experience is unique and could be a lot of fun compared to strip buffet.  If you plan to come here for hibachi dinner, make sure you understand the rule of roulette. Your dining experience could land on red or black, and sometimes green :-)

Y5yjRRkrsYXlYsA4_n9Dbg.text: Great food, love he a la carte options for hibachi. Sushi is good. Chefs have a few tricks and food is always cooked correctly. Friendly staff make an enjoyable dining experience. Must say that the salad dressing is wonderful. The quality of the ingredients is very good. I wish the chefs would make more sauces to go with your food.

QQqUSv6EO9SfAJ4XSszsbg.text: My love and I heard good things about other Ohjah locations so one night we decided to check out the newest location on Blue Diamond, close to our home. We love sushi and hibachi and have ate at many hibachi type restaurants in and out of Las Vegas. So I was excited and had high hopes of a new restaurant close to home. When we first arrived I noticed the interior, it's beautiful, classy and not the typical Japanese decor that so many other places in town aim for. We were seated and I immediately noticed not only the wonderful smell of others already enjoying their meals, but the menu. Every item is al a cart, reasonable and inexpensive. Considering that we have spent well over $100 at like restaurants in the past for a party of two, I was presently surprised and already liking this place. But let's be honest, if the food is crap.....the prices really are irrelevant right?   So, we both ordered different meats to try more of the menu. Me chicken, he steak. The chef came out and was fantastically funny, sweet and incredibly skillful while cooking. It still blows my mind the cracking and throwing of eggs lol. Anyways, back to the food. It was great! The rice was fluffy, the vegetables were tasty and the meat was cooked to perfection. We have since ate here many times and we have never been let down, I have tried all of the meat/fish items on the hibachi menu and they're all equally delicious. Did I mention I don't think our bill has ever been over $60 including tip? I haven't tried the sushi because the hibachi is so very good it's hard to try something else, when we usually only go there because that's exactly what were craving. I recommend everyone check out Ohjah on Decatur and Blue Diamond.

wyzlpaRaOM7ENGtpAtJQaQ.text: The food at this place is pretty good. The service of the chef is excellent! The place is pretty big and it did not have a line. We came in around 9pm and had a reservation for 7 people and was seated right away. We sat down and watched the show but as soon as the chef placed food in our bowls (within 10 minutes), the waitress immediately asked if we wanted to go containers as well as desserts and immediately handed us the checks without even asking if we were through. She seemed to be in a hurry to get us out. Towards the end, I approached a gentleman and asked to see the manager; he claimed he is the the manager on duty, and his name is Lee. I gave him a feedback with regards to our bad experience and while talking, the waitress with a very bad attitude (TRAN), butt in the conversation and said "oh I thought you're finish" (in a very rude way). She even said she assumed my friend asked for a box when in fact Tran was the one who approached all of us while she saw we were still working on our food. Lee stood aside and let Tran keep on talking to us as she was starting to raise her voice. I expected that if a customer were to address their concern to the staff of the restaurant, the manager should at least stop TRAN from talking directly to the customers as it can only make matters worse but they let her reason out even more. She was very unprofessional and the situation could've been dealt with in a different way by the manager.  We came in to celebrate a party and drove all the way from CA and left very disappointed.Towards the end, we've come to conclusion that Tran must've had the audacity to behave the way she did because a gratuity of 18% was already included so she provided us a very lousy service. In my opinion, she did  not even deserve a $1 tip! Though the food was good and the show was quite entertaining, I won't be returning. I gave the star a place because they are lacking effort into trying to make this better (especially starting with proper training of their wait staff).

XDkW_3onLdnKQ4uOAHbQrA.text: Wanna go to a dinner & a show!? Go to Ohjah! It's a fun and exciting place to go for dinner with family and friends to just celebrate life or their birthdays.   They start off with a Onion soup and a salad with a thousand island dressing. We decided to SAKE BOMBS- House Sake with Sopporo beer, since we've seen every table do it and it looked fun!  Then they started the show! The chefs are super interactive and animated. I've eaten the chicken, salmon & scallops teppanyaki! Then towards the end they make you catch the shrimp!  I honestly have a great time every time I go here! Thanks Ohjah for being an awesome place to make memories!

mgaM28fAzbmRZTfqltb-_g.text: Tip-top  Teppanyaki! It's one of our fav dinner spots. Van is the master of hibachi showmanship, you're extra lucky if he's your chef. The prices are super reasonable, & nice combo menu choices.  There's also  a second restaurant side for regular dinning. A variety of Japanese cuisine & sushi rolls. bSjnAfNG7i4SPu02-Cytng.text: I'm very surprised to see all these really good reviews because the last 2 times we have been here the service and chef have been absolutely horrid ! The manager (not sure if he's the owner ) is never friendly to say the least . I wish I knew the name of our chef the last 2 visits but it's hard when he doesn't wear a name tag or introduce himself . There were 2 families at our table . Between us there were 3 kids 5 and under . A show for the kids , friendliness , etc . , Is way too much to ask for from this chef . 7 out of the 8 orders were only broccoli or mushrooms only not all the veggies . The chef was irritated , said luckily he wasn't hungover, and that we weren't an easy table . We asked for particular sauces . The chef got ours but the guy from the other party requested double of a certain sauce as well . The chef snapped at the guy , said they didn't have that sauce , gave them the sauces they didn't want , and then began cooking as quickly as possible . The tables had people but they had chefs to cover it . This guy has zero personality and rushes through the cooking process . The shrimp was not thoroughly cooked . My salmon wasn't raw but it could have used a few extra minutes of cooking . Our steaks we asked for well done . My husband ordered double filet well done . It wouldn't hurt the cook to actually cook the steak how my husband would like it cooked but that would take too much time . He puts it on my husbands plate , doesn't ask how it is , cleans the grill , and is gone before my husband even has a chance to look at his steak to see that it's definitely medium / medium rare . No where near what my husband asked for . The manager could care less , says he will take my husbands meal off the bill , picks it up , and rushes off with it ?!? Umm , we were there to EAT ! Have you thought that maybe my husband would like to actually EAT and you should offer to cook his meal longer so he can EAT! After the Manager walked off even the other family at the table told me I was exactly right and the chef couldn't have been more rude or in a rush . :(

As we enter, a really nice and cozy type of japanese resto with a dim light approached us. Our server which was also really accommodating, walked us through our table and got our orders..   We let my uncle order since they know what's good there besides, it's their go to place whenever they're craving for japanese food..  They served us tea and salad (I love their salad) for starters..   Moments later, they served us the order.. it was the "ohjah boat" consist of sushi, sashimi and nigiri.. a tempura and I forgot the other one actually.. I really love the presentation of their boat and all the food tasted so fresh and mouth-watering..   (Just a warning: for those of you who are sashimi or nigiri lovers.. there's a parasite warning in the news and you should watch out or just be careful ordering or making some sushi these days, unless you're sure on the resto or where you buy it from..)  but other than that, I believe that this resto is safe and clean! I actually can't wait to go back!

I must say, we have lived right across the street from Ohjah for the last 5.5years and tried it for the first time the other night. I cant believe we have been missing out for so long. We sat on the Hibachi side and enjoyed it very much! Our chief was great! The fried rice was some of the best I've ever had and the filet mignon was so tender and good. The onion soup and the house salad they bring out when you first sit down was very good as well. The servers were very attentive and super nice. The owner or manager was very attentive and friendly as well. We will definitely be returning for future date nights as well as recommending to friends.

cKpprK7UO3Mf20WarUHDQg.text: I ordered the chicken and shrimp. The shrimp were not deveined so I refused to eat them. When I inquired about the shrimp, I was told "that's how they're served" and they haven't had any complaints. The sauces were different from what I have back home, yet delicious. There were a few new table tricks performed that I had not seen before.

4s9uLJ5Oq1iF_Z_uJZnJxQ.text: The ojah hibachi is a restaurant that my bf and i truly enjoy. The food is good and the shows are always fun. There are some wonderful chefs like the sir in the yellow hat who is our favorite. HOWEVER, today I had an unpleasant experience with a newer, inexperienced employee.  We brought our friends here and the chef we were given was inexperienced not just for the hibachi show (which wasnt much of a show), but apparently also in cooking. We noticed first that he burned the egg and the portion sizes of food was not enough for the table of 9 people... to the point some people had remnants of vegetables....  The vegetables were not fully cooked- cold and too crunchy. The noodles were ill seasoned.  My boyfriend ordered a rare stake (we also had rare filet yesterday) and it was RAW. NOT RARE. THERE IS A DIFFERENCE. It was cold like fridge cold in the middle, half was cooked rare and the rest raw. Rare steak is not supposed to be Cold!!!We had filet at Mon Ami Gabi yestrday and it was no where near that infact it was perfectly cooked.  After confronting the manager he kindly went to make a new one for us.  Then. THE PREVIOUS CHEF CAME TO ARGUE WITH US!!!!! HE DIDN'T EVEN APOLOGIZE JUST STRAIGHT UP ARGUING!   The manager apologized for the chefs behavior and generously compted the steak meal. As well as preparing a better one.  I normally love the hibachi here and the chef in the yellow hat, but this one chef was just inexcusable. Thankfully the manager did his best to help resolve the situation. And also, I do realize that some situations isnt necessarily the restaurants fault but sometimes employees mistakes, the food was still pleasing and at least the rest of the crew was still kind and concerned about our enjoyment- which I do appreciate. The manager even called us later to apologize which is a very honest and respectable thing to do, I appreciate and accept the apology. I know it wasn't his fault.

cQlC8-e_hGXce6HnwURRtA.text: Dropped in with crew after a race. We were tired  hungry and 4 hours from home which generally makes me hard to please. "Sushi" was better than expected, we did not try rolls. Food was above a 4 but below a 5. All staff was a 4 with the exception of our chef who was a 7, and we do a lot of tepan so the gimmick stuff is lost on me by now, he was different and excellent.  Rating on a overall 1.5hr experience, not picking it apart.

EcvB46RsvCkhA10g6vmy0w.text: Our family loves this restaurant , they serve great food and very entertaining.

VlGlBBCjPGhd43GtIROQ-A.text: One of the better sushi joints in the area. I've been here a few times and try to come by whenever I'm in Vegas. The fishes are fresh, so right on !! They've got a great selection of appetizers and sushi on the menu. If you don't like raw fish they serve a large variety of cooked food as well such as chicken terriyaki or noodles. This place never seems to disappoint. I'm always a satisfied customer !!!! Plus, I love the service and the attentive servers.   Note - I usually order the sashimi salad, its spicy here though. I love that b/c it gives the salad an extra kick. Most sashimi salad I've tried aren't spicy at all, so this place makes it extra special. Different !! The baked green mussel are delish and a must order !! Needless to say, the sushi of course is off the hook !!

O_7_KGWQXfDgyU9LnB1sKQ.text: First thing I would like to say is if you want to go to ohjahs DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION, go to the Pecos location. Walked in about 5 o'clock pm and the manager was standing right at the front counter and did not acknowledge us for about 2 min. He finally asked us how many people we had after a line had formed behind us. We tell him we have two people for the grill, he says "you want hibachi?" Yes that's why we asked for the grill. He picks up his notepad and tells us not until 7 o'clock and then he just ignores us. I asked him if he was going to get my name and he says "you're going to wait 2 hours?" WHY DO YOU THINK IM ASKING YOU???? We had no problem waiting. The manager is rude and does not have any customer service skills. We decide to call the PECOS LOCATION and they politely tell us a time which was only 30 min from when I called so we head over to that location. WOW the difference in management is evident as soon as you walk into the door. GO TO THE PECOS LOCATION you will not regret it but you will regret going to the one on Decatur.

PJ_xhUyqAIJy9yguZ_0sRw.text: My favorite Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas .     Their food is some of the best I have ever had . The staff here is very friendly and helpful. The service is always on point.     For fun day. Try Habachi grill ! Also sushi is very good quality too.     I love here and for sure I will come back again and again .

GV2Ir44xXn9q5oBRV28wDg.text: Well, honestly we would have followed Larry the sushi chef anywhere.... however, this place is pretty cool. Sushi on point, waitress was nice, the place is very clean and inviting. Not having a all you can eat kinda sucks, but ive been to alot of GOOD places that dont need that anyway to fill the seats. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Rt0BfP4yaLSj4N--UPq9nw.text: I'm a fan of Japanese steakhouses so I was excited to try this place. Dinner started with soup and salad which comes with every teppanyaki meal. The salad dressing is amazing!!!! I am not a fan of salad, but I loved this!! It is really sweet and doesn't taste like any other dressing I've ever had. Each order comes with soup, salad, vegetables, and the choice of fried rice, noodles, or steamed rice.  The basic entree is $8.95 with the items listed above, then you add whatever else you want. For example, I ordered Filet Mignon and Shrimp Teppanyaki which added $13 to the basic price. I like the menu style because it is  "Mix & Match" so you can create the perfect meal.  The steak was delicious and very good quality. The shrimp however had a very strong shrimp taste which I don't like. (I am very picky about shrimp!) After dipping them in one of the sauces provided it was better. Finally, the fried rice was delicious!!  Overall: Delicious and inexpensive teppanyaki dinner! I would say they are in the top 3 :)

KIh28XsyBWgvqjJNtDOSCQ.text: Fast and friendly service.   Our first meal in Vegas! Woohoooo!!  Waiting for our food nomnom. I'll update what the food taste

LcnZ1cJr28dmB5zVZFV74g.text: My husband and I have been here at least 6 times in the last five months. We have never disliked anything we have ordered. The waitresses are always very sweet and accommodating. We tend to sit in the main part of the restaurant for sushi and chicken teriyaki (basic, I know) and it is always soooo good! We did try the hibachi side once when company was in town and it was tasty. We always take advantage of whatever YELP deal they have going, especially the free Sake

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s a great price for such yummy food!

ro5vh-So9MZxh04B6bK3mQ.text: Always fast service here! The seafood yakisoba and the lasagna roll is my favorite! For a fun date , try the hibachi grill!

6gVS_9K87Ai9EcA0HYbh9g.text: I've been here a couple times before and I always felt like the man at the door, not in uniform who I assume is either the manager or the owner of the place is kinda unfriendly, but today he was just straight up mean and rude to me and my little nephew. We came in around 6:30 for dinner and I realized the place was packed as soon as we walked in. I saw him as I entered and asked if we could have hibachi for 2. He said "No, we're full but there are tables out here". I thought his response came across very short and uninviting. I promised my nephew who I don't get to see often a fun dinner where he would get to see the hibachi chef do all kinds of cool tricks and now that's not happening so I'm trying to figure out if my nephew wants something else there like sushi or teriyaki or ramen, etc...and while I'm asking my nephew what he wants that man rudely interrupted me: "are you eating here?" And I swear there was no one waiting behind us. It's not like we were holding up the line. Anyways, my nephew said he wanted sushi so we stayed and got one of the tables in the regular dining area. We got water right away but then sat for about 15 minutes before that same man came to check on us and take our order. As I ordered the chicken teriyaki, he asked if I wanted white rice or fried rice. I turned to ask my nephew if fried rice is ok since he'll be sharing some of my food, and he was a little distracted so before he could answer my question, the man just grabbed the menus on the table from under my arm and walked away angrily. I thought that is extremely unprofessional and disrespectful of customers. His attitude was just indescribably rude and so uncalled for towards me and my little nephew. If he doesn't have the patience to serve, he shouldn't be working in a customer service job. First of all, the food is ok, not that impressive to begin with. I've been to many different teppanyaki places before and I've had better.  Second, I'm paying to eat there. It's not like I'm there begging for free food. I didn't pay to get treated like that. I am extremely and absolutely angry, disgusted and displeased with the offensive service I received at this Ohjah today and will definitely NEVER COME BACK!

LrRTzTQyLTIEvN47cXixkA.text: best place for a fun time and great food.  david is the best chef they have and a clown ... great customer service ... love it here.

8sCm0ZdBzFkgDkS_YW2gqw.text: Great experience! A friend of mine came in town for the holidays and we found this spot on Yelp. The restaurant was clean, comfortably tempered, and well lit. The front dining area has tables, as well as seating along the bar. We sat in the side room at the hibachi grill.   The food was great..I ordered the shrimp & chicken hibachi with fried noodles. My friend ordered shrimp and filet mignon with fried rice..everything was cooked to perfection. The hibachi chef, waitress, and bartender were all friendly and accommodating.   I only gave 4 stars because the price to have Seabass as an add on in your habachi was higher than I would have expected. I would absolutely go back and recommend to others.

DwXEqxxJ4ZqhQU7L7IbVHg.text: This is probably the best Japanese resturants in town. The staffs are really kind and willing to help you to decide what is good. Lots of fresh seafood and great steaks, tasty! Had really good time in here and definitely going back here. Thank you Ohjah!

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters!

7Rj3lVbJ5MTP9oMrABRHYQ.text: I tried the filet mignonette hibachi.  The beef was very tender and cooked just right.  Clear soup and house salad were standard offerings and tasted good.  The only criticism was the fried rice was a little hard, so it needed some more cooking.  The service was excellent.  Overall, a very good meal.  HUGE UPS for seating me at the hibachi grill, even though I was the only one ready to eat.  I have never understood why so many Japanese steakhouses won't fire up the hibachi for only one person, but Ohjah did for me and I appreciated that.

g_fdmZX8HupzIkPTKk50Kw.text: Service: Outstanding! Everyone in the restaurant wore a smile and had a great positive attitude! I give 5 STARs just on the service.  Appetizer:  Fried Oysters.  I am from Eastern NC, so I typically like my fried oysters in a light batter.  The fried oysters batter was very thick and greasy.  It was also served with BBQ sauce.    Dinner: The salad dressing that they serve is different.  It's almost like a mayo based ginger salad dressing.  It was not my favorite. I like that the portions are not HUGE, so you could actually finish it.  I like that the chef was VERY accommodating of how I wanted my food to be cooked.  He was very happy to cook my food separately.

OHPAXTFmx0zSBbweintb_A.text: Note: Can't comment on the hibachi because we did not choose that option.  Came here for a dinner with the family as a first-timer and I was pleasantly surprised. The food is great. I recommend trying the Holy Moly and Gyu-Ishiyaki for starters.  Service was great as well. We were served by a really nice young lady (I forgot her name, sorry) who was extremely polite.  A great place to try if you're undecided on a Japanese restaurant. :)

0coPinlfWp9wiUbc8w_JiA.text: This place is amazing. The staff is always so accommodating and since we come here quite often they always acknowledge us.  The space isn't much to look at from the outside but as my mother always says, it's what's inside that counts! There are 3 types of seating..the Sushi Bar, regular dining off the menu and hibachi dining. We generally always go to hibachi.  The menu consists of the usual steak, chicken and shrimp but the also offer Kobe beef, lobster, salmon and scallops. You get your choice of fried rice or noodles and you start with onion soup and ginger salad. The salad dressing they use is amazing and unique.  We always each order a steak and split the lobster. Make sure to have them cook with garlic and give you a side of teriyaki sauce for your rice, you won't regret it!   We come here at least once every other month and it still feels like a treat. Can't wait to go back!

F6D4QJIGRr1HAFTtGFt3rQ.text: This place is our go to for Japanese teppanaki. They don't cook with any msg and that is always what makes my stomach hurt at the other places that are similar. I wish their sushi was better but we aren't here for sushi! Chefs are definitely enjoyable ! We will keep coming back

QP8zJcVNeTmzMyFWYqS7jg.text: brand new hibachi/sushi joint at reasonable prices!  we've been to ohjah (or king of the ninjas so the hibachi chef tells us!) on multiple occasions since its just around the corner from our house.  at first, i thought this place wasn't going to do well since the location is kind of weird (off blue diamond and decatur, but in a tiny side shopping center thats pretty much empty).  but right when this place opened, we've noticed its been packed... all the time!  the sushi... awesome!  very fresh and the flavors are great.  they have a ton of variety too.  prices are pretty sushi normal (expect about 10ish bucks for a specialty roll, 5ish for the standard rolls).  we got the volcano roll, tiger roll, and a bunch of nigiri (white fish nigiri... sooo good!).  all the sushi, excellent.  the volcano roll was covered in this interesting mix of scallops and sauce.  my kind of roll!  the hibachi was cool too.  i love the prices... its a lot cheaper than most hibachi places i've tried before.  you pay $8.95 for the hibachi basics then add on your meats for around 6 bucks (more expensive for better meats of course).  the food was pretty good and the chef was truly entertaining.  he was super ninja with his tricks and we all were able to catch the shrimp in our mouths.  boom!  the place is stylish and the service is nice.  their only fault i think is that the waitresses always try to up sell you to more things at the beginning (but it doesn't bother me that much).    definitely a must try!

WDLypRsiUG9T3T0npjufOQ.text: Great food. I eat here at least 1 or 2 or more a month. Do the hibachi. And also get to go food about the same amount of time a month. Hibachi side The chefs are amazing. Some are funnier than others. To go you always have amazing service.

WNaB3DaZtPNAXyipj7e06g.text: Very yummy and affordable !! The food and service was great !! Tons of great items to choose from . Will definitely be back!!

ix7pdRbOKlPhiF1KHh3XLA.text: I've ordered take out and sat in and have always enjoyed myself. Of course I didn't add the extra star because of the wait, sometimes. But that's how good this place is.

5JSQ76DVoQ2PHax9mdV10Q.text: Came here w my family and had hibachi. We were seated promptly and everyone was friendly. The menu had lots of choices for sushi and hibachi. They even surprised my mom with a happy birthday dessert. It was great food, great service, & a great time.  It was nice that we could go somewhere as a family.  My brother has a 4 year old son and things can get loud as we all talk with him & play with him.  Ohjah gets 5 stars for the accommodations, friendliness, clean restaurant, professionalism of the staff, quality of food, & prices.  We were seated promptly but we did arrive at 6:00pm. When we left at 7:00-7:30, there was a wait and small crowd at the door.

1fZefkiRr1vv5-14SlolLg.text: Ate here for the first time and i gotta say the hibachi is definitely well worth the price. the only thing that is lacking is the flavor. i  had the filet mignon and scallops and chicken. Now their scallops and filet mignon were cooked perfectly. Now for a new place its always packed and thats a good thing, but if you were to compare to Geisha House i would pick Geisha House for food quality and Ohjah for the price. We also tried this albacore and fried onion sushi roll which was delicious. But the hibachi was lacking good sauces and their cooks were not that entertaining and the fried rice was ok.i will come back just dont know when i will say OHJAH is what im craving today.

e7hSwlLUHFRs8tDpNAaOEg.text: Worst teppan I've ever had. We had the older gentleman cooking our food. The stove was too hot and he was slow. He burned it all. vegetables were horrible burnt and mushy. The fried rice was over cooked and chewy. The chicken was extremely over done and chewy. I have never had crispy salmon before but it was alright. The steak was the only thing that was cooked right. I will never go here again for Teppan. Very disappointed since it had such high reviews.

3iie9ddYfKLn-Yk--2WRmg.text: I'm a first time sushi eater and all the things I heard about sushi joints is that they smell like fish and are a bit dodgy. This place smelled great and it was very clean. Next, went to the bathroom to check the cleanliness - spotless!   Then the staff was so friendly. From the way they spoke to you to the way they cleared our table, great service.   You gotta see MANDY! She was so patient, understanding and funny. She made me ver comfortable for my first time. I will come back again. I went to "I Love Sushi" and I didn't enjoy my experience there and so I haven't been back to a sushi place in years because I didn't enjoy my experience - until today!   Come to this place and bring your friends!

feJ3xO6AzJmaQy_GadJFbA.text: I arrived an hour before closing and the service was EXCELLENT. The food is superb if you are in Las Vegas you must stop by.

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. black widow roll and show me the love roll

PWwsMmeIlokcejghJFNqVA.text: Phenomenal food!! The sushi was amazing & so was the teriyaki beef wrapped around cream cheese with green onions!!! Yummy!!! The service was wonderful & the restaurant was so clean!!

Y4wDBiLIaatr4la_mP22-w.text: How did this place receive 4 stars?? I came in on a Thursday night after work at the Blue diamond location  and the service I can say was great but was totally subpar food. I enjoyed my Sapporo bottled beer but the filet and subsequent rice and vegetables sucked!!! The dipping sauces were watery and not flavorful so I couldn't remedy my overdone medium rare filet which was medium to medium well now at best. I have reviewed many restaurants on yelp fairly- and tonite this place was horrible. I hate giving bad reviews but ohjah please do something with your hibachi grill food!!! It is marginal at best!!

TBDE3wLI0etXHCK1oS9j_g.text: Staff is beyond friendly, everyone will thank you - all smiles.  This is my 2nd time eating here: salad and entree was delish, however the soup was pretty much water. The 4 in our group sent it back; we agreed it was like watered down canned broth. It was all liquid and some wonton strips... No scallions or mushrooms. Three filets were ordered and cooked perfectly, I ordered salmon which was a bit dry but I used a dipping sauce which satisfied my taste buds. Serving portion is huge - no need to order any appetizers if choosing hibachi. We also ordered a bottle of Fuji apple sake, only 8% alcohol so it's very weak.  You need to like apple juice because it tastes exactly the same and just as sweet.

rifYA9Dqy5m36oLT_3ubQg.text: I went here with my family (party of 11) for my birthday dinner and I am really glad that we opted to go here. Everything about this place was perfect, from the ambience and service to the food itself. Definitely try the Hibachi combo if you're going here, it's a really good value for the quality and quantity of food that you receive. On top of that, the hibachi chef was incredibly talented and passionate about what he was doing. We arrived late for our reservation (sorry :( ) but the waiter was very understanding about it and didn't even rush us even with another reservation for our table only an hour from the time we arrived. Overall, it was a great experience and I will be back next time I visit Vegas! 100% recommended.

FcqNspSjrF3EjNXGt4N6Lg.text: I come to Ohjah pretty frequently and leave completely satisfied each time. Each visit we are greeted with a smile by the friendly staff. Whether it's hibachi or just regular dining, the food never disappoints. I typically enjoy ordering the 3 roll special or the Ohjah boat. They also have an amazing selection of sake, some of which are not on the menu. Service and management are top notch! All the servers I've had are so kind and attentive. It's always packed at this location, so make reservations!

wQfCozV29v8nXIakddfh1g.text: This is the best hibachi place!!! It is totally reasonable in price! Awesome food, great service-drink never went empty! We are totally coming back!!!

T544G_4BtjQwdMFCrgmxQQ.text: Whenever I call Ohjah for takeout, they're short on the phone and act like it's an utter inconvenience, even though they advertise takeout. I live right around the corner and tip every time i pick up food, so i don't understand the problem. Tonight was no different and when I picked my food up, I finally asked the man (the same curt person on the phone) if he didn't like takeout orders bc he wasn't very nice. He actually answered that it was a pain when they're busy!! He didn't even apologize and just continued to be rude. The food here is quite good, I order takeout several times per week, and it's one of the better sushi places in town, but they're so rude and clearly don't appreciate my business, so I won't bother with this restaurant again. Many more sushi places that are delicious and make me feel welcome.
