I9FCIo4S6GExtg39QGHWlg.text: You can't beet the Sushi Boat and everyone is very friendly.

-i9BRh1mbg4XTWFts0QT8Q.text: this place is the absolute worst. me and my friend wen there, shes from fort lauderdale fl and i decided i would take her somewhere nice but inexpensive since i've been there before and it was okay... but after tonight i will never step feet int hat place again. first the chef was sloppy, unhappy, and catch an attitude with the lady that was sitting across from us because the waitress forgot one of the fried rice she ordered so she brought it to his attention(the chef) and he said "i have nothing to do with that, ask her for another one". the chef didnt make it fun while all the other hibachi tables was excited and making noises we were the most quite table ever. so then after he cooked the fried rice which wasnt good, it was mushy(since when are fried rice mushy?) no seasoning what so ever, to make it worst, i found freaking multiple pieces of tissue cooked in to my rice"SO DISGUSTING" like i was literally chewing paper, gross! i brought it to the chef attention and he didnt even apologize, he walked away and got the manager(a male) and guess what he said "its from my straw, sure because i am a 3 year old baby who would take paper from a straw and mixed it in to my rice then try to eat it, are you kidding me? he didn't even offer to do anything about it so we just asked for the check and i attempted to search the rice again, guess what? more paper. when the lady brought the check, i said "do you still think i put straw paper in there (showing her other pieces of napkin) lol this is funny, she said "ITS JUST PAPER, ITS OKAY" i guess shes used to eating paper at home so i basically payed for food that i didnt not eat.... never again.

x5RKgE1ZbdP7bx3iyDerWQ.text: Wonderful food and very good service. My husband and I have tried the Habachi grill which is superb, the regular menu is varied and everything we have ordered has been tasty. There is never a wait for a table or a place at the grill. I have not tried the sushi but it looks good.

C2M84fcYSDVATeBIN2N7mg.text: My wife, daughter and I ate there last night and each of us enjoyed a great Hibachi meal. We were warmly greeted and seated promptly at an immaculately clean hibachi table. The wait staff was both polite and attentive. Our menu questions were answered and our order taken quickly. Our Hibachi chef was skilled and entertaining and cooked our meals to perfection. We each had the hibachi combination meals trying different selections and found all offerrings to be fresh and very flavorful. A minor error in our order was immediately corrected without fuss and the whole table benefitted with a taste  of the selected item cooked in error.We had anxiously awaited for the openning of Ohjah and were not disappointed. Our departure was heralded with the thanks of each staff member we passed and invited to return soon.We will return often.

d96YUT4fnOyp7K9Br0zjQg.text: I wanted to like this place, the one time I went the food was good, price was great, and hibachi is always fun (however the service was terrible, the waitress didn't speak english, seemed miserable, and came by to refill our drinks MAYBE once.)  However, I thought it would be a neat place to have my bday and bring 7 of my friends.  The day of my bday I called and asked if I could make a reservation for 9 pm.  They told me no, the only time they could fit me in was 8 pm.  A little too early, but I make my friends rush and we get there at 8 pm on the dot.  The employee at the front was SO RUDE, said there was no way i made a reservation because he was working   the phone all day and I didn't call, and then DEMANDS to see my phone as proof that I  called and made a reservation.  After I show him my phone, he says "Was this today"... umm it clearly is timestamped saying today. Then he says "Well we have no room, you can come back at 9". WHAT?! that was the original time I wanted and you said I couldn't have!?!?  Needless to say, he totally ruined my bday!

s7MZ6gpT3GXSRTdRXeDagw.text: I've been coming to ohjahs for about 2 years and tonight has by far been my worst experience. I usually get the hibachi fillet mignion which is around $10. They refused to accommodate because I wanted to order that and was sitting in the restaurant area. (Perfect amount of food.) I don't really care where it's cooked. So I asked if I could get the kids mean which is TINY, $14 dollars and doesn't even come with noodles. So I had to order noodles on the side which was another $3. I don't mind paying for what I want because I know they're a bit expensive, But they didn't want to change anything! The service ungodly awful. Refills took 10 minutes, horribly rude... I won't be back. I don't even want to give one star... TAKE YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE!

RreLYixLS--ozlsfOlWTng.text: The rolls we ordered were cold and the sushi was small . The rice was really sticky. It was a little on the high side when it came to the price,the sauce in the rolls was too sweet.  The waitress was hard to communicate with but she was nice. I don't think I will becoming back here again there are other sushi joints in the area that are better when it comes to food service & prices.

LzQvwCc9NA1BVIgTMNsl3g.text: This was our first time here--the manager was amazing making sure that everything was taken care of because we needed to eat gluten free.  The cook also was attentive in that respect so that we were assured that everything would be cooked the way we requested it.  Our waiter was equally wonderful.  Service was obviously excellent and the food was really top shelf---without a doubt the best Hibachi dinner we've had.  Great wine selection--great atmosphere----all in all a wonderful dining experience!

kIv3bAlyX8AEdbh4xUqdBQ.text: The service was the worst we have had iin years. My wife and I ate there tonite. We live near by and have been waiting for it to open.  We were seated right away. PBkN_u2gZMeu5wcZIRi5vw.text: The price is very reasonable.  Portions are generous.  Dinner for4 came out to a little bit more than $100 and everybody was full and satisfied. The service was excellent and I could not ask for more. I do recommend you call for a reservation because we came at 6 PM on a Friday and it was almost full.  I would definitely come back again.

kDFEwy3ji2LuBiZ9Q7njyg.text: I've been to Ohjah several times for both their sushi and hibachi style food and I've always been pleased with their food. i5CrflzsfwwJBfjrYYxYtg.text: Wonderful experience!!! The food is great! We had the shrimp and the filet mignon with onion soup, salad and fried rice; delicious. _skAMX3Os3G_Jek94hA4wg.text: Went to a friends bday to the teppan grill for party of 6. We had great service and the food was so good. Prices are reasonable too. Glad I found this place very near to where I live

oiarOS2KPt2eEeisgHsDhg.text: I've eaten here about four times in the last two months. Each time hoping to get a different experience. Obviously looking for a better experience from the time before. I never quite got the experience I was looking for.  let me quantify this entire review by saying I am a huge fan of Teppanyaki and Japanese cuisine. Every city I go to I always seek out some kind of Japanese restaurant. so when I move to my new house and saw that this restaurant was less than two minutes away I was super excited. My first experience I walked in with my brother before Christmas. There was no one at the hostess counter to meet me. When we told him it was for three people they just stared blankly at me and then told me OK you can wait. We sat there for a little bit of time and then finally were taken back to the hibachi tables. We were greeted promptly by the host of the actual table. He brought our drinks and took our orders quickly.  once we received our orders the show started and the chef was fabulous. My six-year-old son highly enjoyed it. It was what you would expect out of a typical hibachi show. The food was decent but not superb. Obviously I ate there multiple times so the food was extremely palatable but I have definitely had better flavors in hibachi cuisine at other places in town.  I received my receipt after payment and went on my way. My next experience was about three weeks after that. Taking my other brother there for sushi. We walked in and the host who is the gentleman seemed completely disgusted and appalled that we didn't have a reservation. He pointed to the small dining area in front of them and said "you see these people they wait before you OK!" And then he turned his back and walked away. Still not knowing how long our wait time was we kind of just hung out in front of the door. Shortly after another gentleman came up and said can I help you. We told him we were waiting for hibachi and he laughed and said" oh no we know see you tonight. Two hour wait."so we left. my six-year-old who loves Japanese food was quite disappointed. But we try to give it another shot the next night. Hoping for either a different host and experience. When we were thinking about going back I called to make reservations this time. I made a reservation so that way we wouldn't have the same experience. But to my surprise when we arrived again they acted surprised even though my name is on the reservation list and sat me and told me we had to wait. Our reservation was at 7:30 PM. We ended up not being seated till close to eight. My confusion lies in the fact that if you make a reservation you should be seated around your reservation time correct? Obviously they should have a table waiting for you. Again we were seated and eight in the routine was the same. all in all if I'm in dire in desperate need for hibachi I'll go back. Ultimately the food is decent and it gives my son pleasure. But if I brought company back into town I definitely would not bring them to this restaurant.

NnYToKWvcYOnWKidKkgAXw.text: Habachi at it finest. Not only do they do habachi, but they do a variety of sushi rolls. Perfectly priced for your wallet and it fun to end the night catching a shrimp with your mouth.  If you don't know what I'm talking well.  It's a dinner and a showmanship by the cook.  You pick your meat and  a cook comes out with meat and veggies to grill in front of you. He will also made fried rice in front of you and make a volcano  out of onions. It's really fun. I took my in laws and they loved it.

pGQw-Cc5MgR67xovlMORPg.text: I love their miso ramen soup. Flavors hit the spot. The Ohjah fried rice is really good too. My daughter loved their chicken katsu. It's my new go to ramen spot. I also like how you don't feel crowded here.

SbXujlHYJvUgmVhlRP1pgA.text: The last time we ate at Ojhah in Las Vegas was in 2014.  They impressed us so much that we came to try their Hibachi this time.  TIP:  Apparently you need reservations for the Hibachi.  We didn't have any so we had to wait 30 minutes.  Luckily there is a drug store next door you can pass the time in.  We were seated with a lovely family of 6.  All together there were 4 kids under 10 years old, our 2 teens (14 & 16 years old) and 4 parents.  The other Hibachi got the more enthusiastic chef.  Ours was just meh.  The fried rice made via Hibachi is always good but the meat (chicken) was kind of dry and tasteless.  I guess that's why they give you sauce.  What they did not give me was my free sake for checking in via Yelp.  I did order a salmon skin hand roll which was excellent.  I think they do better with their sushi than their Hibachi.  I'd probably return for their sushi, but I was not at all impressed with the Hibachi.

AmRR8CzkQ_ZrPPiXNM5Puw.text: I was excited that I was able to to talk my hubby into ANYWHERE I could get a bite of sushi so we decided to try out this new Hibachi spot in our area.   Our friend met us there and hubby and I got there it was about 5pm and upon opening the door, there was no one there. No one. Customers or hostess.  Ummmmmm......so I walked to the left a little and realized that the hibachi area was around the corner in a different room.  We walked ourselves around the room then found hibachi area. I posted several pics.  Honestly it reminded me of the "ol'school" Benihana.......I just was not impressed. You have zero servers and if you get water or a drink you are lucky. The grill master Ven was suppose to be the best but just acted like he did not care that night.  I got the Sushi Fiji and hubby got the Prime hibachi. Mine was just a pile of unfrozen bay scallop looking fried madness and hubby kept telling Ven "NO I'M ALLERGIC TO SHELLFISH" when he kept trying to throw shrimp in his mouth.  Our friend order a roll and saki......he was also not impressed.  It is next to a new Lee's Liquor's that has craft beers.....that's another ball of GOOD YELP wax :)

q3fDPC9wDDqPx2yhVpUZuA.text: Oyishi ( meaning very good in japanese) for Ohjah!! I freaking love this place! My friend and I decided to give this place a try, she had told me this place had so many good reviews and the pictures made us drool!!! YELP REVIEWS did not lie! This was so gooooooood!!  We started witht he Edame and the wontons.. Very delicious not that pricey about $3.95 each for appetizers..  Then for our entree we ordered the Ohjah boat which consisted of 3 rolls of your choice along with sashimi and seaweed salad for $49  And also we ordered the New York Steak Teriyaki..$14.99  From the moment they served the food we were in awe., Loved the presentation and love how the Boat full of sushi was huge! Loved the detail with the food presentation as well. The sushi was amazing! It melted in your mouth and you can tell the sashimi was fresh with the correct temperature without the VEINS popping in your mouth! As for the teriyaki steak it was to die for!  So in the end we couldnt finish everything.. we didnt even need to order appetizers we were so full we had so much left overs from the sushi and the steaks..  But of course we still made room for their famous tempura icecream which was so good!  I must say you can tell a huge difference when ordering from an all you can eat sushi place..   Ohjah is one of my top 5 japanese place and I will of course return  and will be a loyal customer!  P.S. they also have the hibachi tables if you are into that..

LtMqHm0lmMDnwzd5I_8pZQ.text: The food was good and our waitress was great. If that was all that happened they would have gotten 4 stars, but it wasn't. My brother texted me that they made a reservation and they were like a couple minutes away. I tell the hostess we have a reservation under my brothers name. She tells me she seated them, which is weird seeing as how she told me I can walk and find them and came back and told her they were not there. I told her that no they are not seated and my party wasn't here yet. She preceded to tell me I was wrong as if I don't know wtf my family looks like. She raised her voice. Also, the "reservation table" had the more experienced teppanyaki chef, which was a bummer... especially since it was my mom's bday, she would have enjoyed it a lot more. The chef we got was ok and he didn't seem too excited lol.

dNCbJQuMv0ZIHiriWqVM_A.text: This is our favorite Japanese Hibachi Grill and Restaurant in Vegas. We found it by accident a few years ago and come here for lunch or dinner every time we are in town. They never disappoint. Today was the first time we couldn't get seating at the grill without waiting an hour so we decided to stay and try the regular menu. Again, they didn't disappoint. The waitress kept apologize for the wait (they got slammed all at once) but it really didn't feel like a long wait. We had the chicken teriyaki and filet minion teriyaki.  Absolutely delicious!!

ODp5y59yWE67iHWXjahwgQ.text: My husband and I have been coming here for years now. We absolutely love Ohjahs!! The food and service is always amazing.   Do yourself a big favor - skip Benihanas and go to Ohjah!

NrF6gh90UjWukFxaw514aQ.text: 7 of us went on a Sunday afternoon about 4:30 to the hibachi grill. Within a half hour, they were full so just a heads up you can make a reservation. When you do, request Van for your chef. His excellent skills provide lots of entertainment and the dishes were excellent. We had filet, New York steak, chicken teriyaki. I requested my filet be cooked rare which is somewhat difficult to do when they cut it up on a grill, but it was cooked perfectly. Very tender and juicy. The others enjoyed their meals as well. The onion soup is delicious and even the kids ate it although we didn't tell them it was onion. Loved the fried rice and the crisp tasty vegetables. Looking forward to the opening of their new restaurant November 15 as it will be a bit closer to home.

-6-v4dtNGhFu1dfhqLnIeA.text: Currently at ohjah. My girlfriend and j have been waiting 50 minutes and barely ordered 10 minutes ago. Food was good but wait was terrible. Probably Would revisit   Edit:the owner got back to me and that is very professional on his part! Due to this I will change my rating and I will continue to be a customer. Hopefully it's just a little faster next time  I would recommend the garlic edemame, shrimp tempanaki, and the shrimp tempura, best parts of my meal.

bNa3okszWPU9pBmONWMlHQ.text: My review is on the Hibachi dinner, as we did not have sushi when we went. I do want to say that I become more and more dismayed at the number of sushi establishments that don't even offer a simple Spice Crab roll muchless a specialty roll with spicy crab in it. It seems when I ask for this 'unheard' of ingredient they look at me as if I have a third eye or something and unfortunately their answer to spicy crab = "a california roll with siracha rolled into it" is unacceptable. For those who do not know how to make spicy crab it is merely imitation crab stick chopped up just like they do for the crab salad with a tad bit of siracha and japanese mayo. The sad thing is that the easy way would be to just chop up a crabstick and mix it with the already available Spicy Mayo.... just sayin'   But I digress - the hibachi menu requires that you order the 8.95 base selection which is just your soup, salad, veggies and rice. Scroll down the menu a bit and it gives you the selection of meats and fishes that they serve Hibachi style. Kobe beef runs 48.95. We chose to have the Hibachi combo which allows you to choose 3 selections (excluding Lobster, Halibut and Kobe) but is a nice plethora of flavors that you can try as your meal.  The chefs are very entertaining, the meal is exciting to watch and the final outcome was really delicious. We didn't want for drinks until after the show was over and then we had to flag someone down a couple of times. Not terrible but they had spoiled us during the show serving us every time the glass became half empty.  I would definitely like to go back and see if they can do better with their response for Spicy Crab :-)

baBvSGiXXIYiEDQiiw5KQw.text: I've been here once, so maybe it's too soon to write a rave review and if our next few trips are as good as this one - they'll probably get bumped to a 5 star review. Picked up dinner here on the way home. Had Chicken and Steak Teriyaki dinners - both were really good, love the soup - nice to get an onion broth rather than miso, salad dressing... what is in this stuff??? I'm in love - like typical habachi ginger/garlic dressing only creamier... also there was one little crab ragoon with the dinner that was super tasty. Steak was tender - chicken good too. Sushi was good, only tried a California roll to test them out - so can't really comment too much on the sushi. Husband had a couple hand rolls he liked. So all in all, pretty satisfied. They do seem to be a little pricy - but I was pleasantly surprised with the meal.

d61ZWJ_BZryEmYeg7xMxsw.text: I live within a minute from this place. And I couldn't be happier to have a Japanese Restaurant near me. But I wish they had bento box options (like most Japanese Restaurants do), which they could revenue from those who don't eat seafood, or for the children..

The filet mignon was so juicy, tender and flavorful. I thoroughly enjoyed this place and highly recommend it. :) Would love to go back again.

However, the service for the Hibachi grill was a little slow because they couldn't get our grill to heat up. We were sitting there for a good 20 mins before our server explained to us what was going on. Luckily...the food made up for the delay and I will definitely come back to give them another try.

UJ6mVIYdu5jYnuEqjLv0ww.text: Last night was my 2nd time there and once again the food and the atmosphere was amazing. The two chefs I've had we're phenomenal and hilarious. Would definitely recommend this to friends.

LdqgtOMBwL8dHM7NJNe0_w.text: We went for hibachi dinner last night and it was great. We had reservations for 5 and were seated as soon as we got there. 3nCn8nNu5eKM9d-XqhExuQ.text: Enjoyed my meal, the food was great and the staff was friendly. Ordered two hibachis - shrimp and salmon - both were prepared well and quickly. Overall I was happy to find this place as they did have a good variety on the menu with reasonable prices, next time I will try a less busy time.

fgpvuldIbGbu0To6ZwXT9Q.text: Scrump!!  And mother of god...the "Show me the love" roll. Allow me to drool ok the keyboard...okay I'm done. KAMPAI!

HbaMC9Ltbrh5Wz7PhdLXaw.text: This is our third time here but first time trying their teppanyaki. The a la carte menu has pretty good items including sushi rolls. Before tonight this was just a safe place to try decent Japanese near our home. Having the teppanyaki was the best decision! The cook also puts on a show, like the flaming onion ring volcano plus he launches shrimp from the grill into the patrons mouths. Now on to the food... we got the sukiyaki beef and NY steak (both prepared medium) as well as scallops, shrimp and salmon. For group of five, we just got 2 orders each of the above to share and it proved plenty. Totally loved everything we were served! I finished it all but the rest of the family had to get take out boxes. Also included were a cup of onion soup, salad with ginger dressing and grilled vegetables, which was also pretty good. The service is excellent! We'll definitely be back.

vbWXmrucr4b4rZbS6acm5A.text: By the far the cheapest tappenyaki/hibachi around town. You can seriously get by dinner here for $15 while other places charge $50-80 per plate. Ridiculous!! I was really surprised when I saw the menu on how cheap it was. Especially with the great quality of the food here.  I can only rate on the hibachi section (where they cook your food in front of you) since that's the only part I've experienced. You first start out with a small soup and salad. Veggies are already included in your cooked meal. You choose between fried rice and fried noodle (basically chow mein). Then you pick your meat. They have a pretty good range including chicken, NY steam, filet minion, shrimp, calamari, kobe, etc. They really slab a lot of the food with butter, but I assume that's why it all taste so good.  Chefs are very entertaining. They do all sorts of tricks with their knives and try to entertain you with the food.   The only reason why I am taking off one star is because I encountered 1 chef that was a bit rude. Usually when I come here, all the chefs are pleasant and funny. Recently when I came, the chef asked how I like my steak cooked. So I said "well done." He gave me a nasty look and said "really? Why bother get filet minion then?" It caught me off guard as he came off like that. In my head, I thought why does it matter? He should of just cooked it the way I requested. I felt like he was complaining because he was impatient and didn't wanna keep standing there just to cook mine. It shouldn't matter how one likes their steak...just cook it. I wanted to complain to the manager, but I didn't wanna make that big of a deal of it.   So I'm sorry if you encounter a douchebag chef, but most of them are really nice. Just hope it doesn't offset or ruin your night.   Praying that y'all get a decent chef next time. ~

U1QYA-dDNUTYB4n2XuyDYQ.text: We've been here a few times now and it's a consistent 3 1/2 stars. It is an easy and comfortable environment for a sushi dinner with the family.

I just walked in and ordered a to go order and they were so fast! It only took a few minutes. Highly recommend Ohjah! Food, atmosphere and employees are all five star!

Ui41AHYEsgwzHSFNRpQpRQ.text: Today is the first time I've been Ohjah and I'll visit here second time. Ohjah is a Japanese restaurant with Hibachi. I go to the one located in the crossing of Decatur Blvd and Blue Diamond Rd. It is hard to find a proper parking lot in dinner time. The restaurant is separated as two parts. One is sushi bar and tables, the other one is Hibachi. Hibachi is so popular that we have to wait for 1 hour to came in. There are 3 big tables that can sit around 60 people. Light is comfortable, Aroma smell good, no music here. The noise is very loud because two many people sitting together and some parties also make noise. Server busser and cooks wear nice uniform. Service is good but I see sometimes elderly has difficulty talking with server, a young Asian lady.  I observed that she tries her best serve all customers but there are too many people eating here and she is the only server in hibachi room. Sometimes the refill beverage is not in time. I think two servers may be better at the dinner time. Food is excellent and affordable. The combination of Ohjah with 7 course is only 32 dollars. The cooking in front of you is also a show that you can enjoy it. Cooks will clean the iron plate very well after finishing cooking. Overall the experience with Hibachi make me feel very good and I definitely will come back.

hbq6gQC4Aw26Qz1HCE11iA.text: I typically come here for my coworkers get togethers but last month I had one of my birthday celebrations here. It was so nice because the Hibachi is not only delicious but the prices are really reasonable. They are also very accommodating because one of my friends brought me a cake and they were nice enough to keep it in their fridge till after our meal. When our meal was finished the waiter cut the cake and served it. They were busy that night but they didn't rush us out. The service and food is excellent! I can't wait till they open the one on Hualapai and Flamingo!

hd-EfxMKKp679Pdw9epV4Q.text: Luckily we made reservations as the hibachi side was packed. We enjoyed the free check in item. I appreciated the ample staff and their service. Our chef wasn't as animated as some of my previous hibachi experiences but he was on point. The lobster was very good and the filet was perfectly cooked and very tasty. One of my kids decided against hibachi and there was plenty on the menu for her to choose. I would recommend them and will return.

epqn4XbCy9jTH_z1Gvwf_g.text: After a day losing money at the casinos, it was time to pause and celebrate my sister's belated birthday with some dinner...she wanted Japanese and this was one of the closest Japanese restaurants from Silverton and Yelp had some favorable reviews.   We opted for the hibachi/teppanyaki and were seated promptly, drinks served, orders taken and ready to dine and be entertained by our teppan chef. Our chef was engaging and entertaining. Sitting with two locals who frequented the place further bolstered our confidence that we made the right choice for dinner...well, they were pretty drunk with multiple sake bombs by the time they started eating so maybe anything will taste good after that. Food turned out to be good and my steak was tender and yummy. Pleasantly surprised by the quality and flavor of the food...it wasn't too salty as is the case with most teppan style cooking. A good find!  I guess drunkenness doesn't really dull one's taste buds after all.

_vrQ2whcwzIr0tTaNUaWMA.text: Pretty good hibachi place. It's your basic/standard hibachi restaurant, nothing really special lol. They are open late which is great. The hibachi prices are fairly reasonable and the service is great. I feel like the chicken and steak could use a little more flavor, but other than that pretty standard.

8xRJBCLxhI-kmBmEyVdFAA.text: This restaurant is a great alternative to other higher priced hibachi chains. The service was friendly, our on-stage chef was entertaining, and the food was well-seasoned and cooked just right.   If you're looking for a family-friendly, fun Japanese dinner out in the Vegas area, I would recommend Ohjah's!

Rj8Noky_yv2Hlh8FMp2CFA.text: Location is just perfect! The food are great and inexpensive. They have fast and friendly service from the moment you walk in til you leave you're greeted with a smile.  Overall I highly recommend this place for everyone.

3jfpjg4xufj5FH7o45idAQ.text: This place rocks! I stumbled to this location because I was buying some liquor from Lee's which is just next door. So I decided. To come back.  The ambiance is great! I actually would rate this as a great place to bring someone on a first date! The lights are dimmed at the restaurant area and the hibachi side was full of energy. They serve sushi and other Asian dishes.   The hibachi is my favorite area.  What's good about it is that you can still order from items from the menu. The chefs are very entertaining.  They joke around with your table and do all the fancy tricks such as making the volcano onion, making the shrimp bunny, etc.    The food is cooked exactly the way your ordered it.  It's very tasteful and the sauce they provide work perfectly with the items you order (fish vs meat vs chicken).    Don't forget to check in because you get a free small sake bottle which was awesome!   The price is very decent compared to other places such as Benihana.  It's about 40% less than the other hibachi restaurants.    I ordered there house combo which was to pick any 3 items for your dish.  It was a surprise that the filet mignon was able to be part of your 3 items.    The staff are super friendly and never has disappointed me.  I've been going at least 1 once month to treat myself and family.  This place is awesome! Stop reading and just go and experience it for yourself!!!

lLLqZJlclBNT1ZMN8EV_wQ.text: We had a great experience and was inexpensive. Staff was very nice and welcoming. We had their combination entree which was enough for two of us and two drinks each our total bill came out to less than 60.00. We enjoyed sitting with a family who was celebrating a birthday and was very generous of them to share their delicious bundt cake. I would definitely go back.

jAdwMMoWX5amji7lzTteCQ.text: It is really hard to rate this place. But In a good way! I have one reference spot for Japanese food in the world it is in Amsterdam (Sapporo - yelp.com/biz/sapporo-ams... ). But Ohjah is coming pretty close to it, so it is hard for me to rate cause they doing one of the best jobs I ever had in America, but they are still a bit below Sapporo. So would I compare this place 1:1 against Sapporo it would get famous four stars. But since it is the best place I found so far in the USA for getting authentic (and not only show related) experience for Japanese food Ill give it a well-earned five-star rating. Food ist fresh, seasoned enough to let the foods own taste shine through. But as well important as that is, they bring the food on the plate when it is at a perfect temperature. Chicken should just be not rare any longer, a scallop has to leave the tepanyaki plate at the right moment, a second later it can be too late. Of course, it is a kind of a gamble, since those hugee places have a lot of chefs and not everyone is perfectly trained or even done with the training. We had luck both times we went and get always chefs that know the products and prepared them perfectly. If you are into Japanese Food and that does not mean sushi then this is the place to go in Vegas and we will be back for sure to enjoy more! Since Amsterdam is to far away for a short trip :)

npgYOTnQOWY4UV9arx2b9Q.text: Not a great meal. The chicken was nasty. Disappointing in the quality of food this evening

RWvHLHjapivlirusadMcNw.text: Hibachi is great and so affordable. If you're in the mood for good sushi, Ohjah has it. As far as apps, the garlic edamame is delicious. Drinks are cheap. This place is a great spot to have in the neighborhood. Staff is friendly and welcoming.

wEs4Ex1LDryOLZrjDJTWjA.text: I've been here twice and both times I have really enjoyed coming. Like a lot of Japanese restaurants there's one side for hibachi and the other for regular tables. Ohjah is always pretty busy but the service is fast and the food is consistently good.   I order the chicken teriyaki appetizer and a side of fried rice. The portions are pretty good size but the fried rice didn't have as much egg as it should have. The sushi here is good and I don't even eat seafood! My friend shared her crunchy shrimp roll called rock n roll, and I just picked out the shrimp. The waitress we had was very nice without overly checking on our table. Some servers check on you every time your mouth is full, so I appreciate the ones who give me my space.  I'll keep coming back here when I'm in the mood for great food & sake bombs.

But a little warning, the secret is out so they do get busy during normal dinner time and weekends, so call ahead for a reservation.

T8WAqNBzPmda-TyFIlwWUQ.text: Quality fresh sushi! Three premium rolls and a glass of wine for $37. The salmon roll with lemon was amazing. Very good!

B0VizaJuoTlWlPA4ifSVzA.text: Ohjah has the most amazing rice and chicken. The people there are so nice and sweet they take care of everything for you. The Service is on point you don't have to ask for another drink they will bring when they see you are low on your drink. The chef are super nice and funny. The place is a little cold so I do think you should bring a jacket, but other than that y'all should totally go it amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In this photo is there onion soup they give you this before you meal.

xfNb26W5kY1XOosztZCuyg.text: Happy Mother's day to all!!!  (Dine in side) Ohjah has definitely been consistent with their establishments.  From their noodle house to their steakhouse both have exceptional service.  We started with appetizers chicken egg rolls, and tempura calamari.  Both were light, flakey, and freshly made.  Give it a couple minutes to cool down because it's that fresh.    My main entree was a side of steam rice, and sashimi chief's choice (5 assorted).  The Chef's  choice was Albacore Tuna, Salmon, Tuna, Yellow tail, and Sea bass was all refreshingly delicious.  The assortments vary everyday, so get your sashimi  adventure taste buds on.    Finally, I order their Green Tea Tempura ice cream enough to share between four people.  The deep fried tempura was excellent.  No too crispy, and not too doughy.  I can not wait to come back, and try their hibachi side.  From what I can tell the hibachi section is great, for couples, or a large group.  I am definitely looking forward to watching the chefs cook my food in front of me with their unique entertaining style.  Dine in section is recommend, for a nice conversation, and a more intimate experience.  Rated based on atmosphere, cleanliness, presentation, taste, and overall satisfaction.

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MdcI2DAJaNOPN4GKo5B5fw.text: Ohjah! Ohjah! What another great dining experience Hibachi style!! I had some friends from the east coast come out to Las Vegas to celebrate a birthday and in the midst of planning everything else I suggested this place because she loves the whole Hibachi teppanyaki thing. Now normally people are quick to turn to Benihana's when they think Hibachi however I just prefer to think outside of the box and not run to what everybody else likes. They are a bit overrated in my opinion but that's neither here nor there. Back to Ohjah..  Reservations were easy as pie to make and the young lady who assisted with the request was very pleasant to work with. We informed them ahead of time that this party of 7 would be celebrating a special occasion which was for the birthday girl! We were a bit late and called them to let them know and still are reservation was held and we began the festivities of what Ohjah has to offer. I really love that they keep things super traditional and at the bar they offer only whatever special drinks they concoct, sake hot/cold and wines both red and white!  Our chef was pretty damn awesome with plenty energy he performed many tricks to impress. The chefs attitude usually can make or break your whole experience at these type of restaurants so it's imperative that you luck up on getting one who truly enjoys the job.  The fact that they went above and beyond to make sure my friends birthday dinner was perfect was absolutely appreciated! The food here was great and I personally enjoyed my Shrimp and fried rice! I will be returning soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l1_NJ1Nr7qFCJWcil0CXSg.text: Our cook was FOB and he made our experience 10 times better! The food and tricks were amazing but he had amazing customer service and was so friendly! Some of the other cooks were very serious and we were so happy to have Fob! He made my birthday a night to remember.

WT7fuVfcqTQTRHACwOXX3g.text: The portions are very generous. The broth with my Udon Soup was some of the best I have ever had. The wait staff was so so. Th Yakisoba was salty and nothing special. They offer a discount for Yelpers ordering sushi. I will come back another time and try the hibachi.

kR_FyTje6m2cdOYlb52Ldg.text: Came here to do hibachi style dining with my friend. We ordered the hibachi combination which allows you to pick three choices of protein which we picked New York steak, shrimp, and scallop. All of this was $31. Which was a great deal. We also ordered a sushi roll. It was love something roll we asked the server for recommend and she recommended that roll and it was really good and refreshing. The scallop for the hibachi was nice big and juicy. It wasn't cheap and small which was awesome! The steak was delicious and good quality and the fried rice was cooked perfectly with enough flavor. The onions in the veggies was very delicious too. Seriously loved everything about this place. Great service too. It's affordable hibachi here and the quality of the food was very good.

C3rN8_zlaPKRjS_2c_yLJw.text: Love the setting here. You can choose the teppanyaki or table. Very affordable and great quality food.

3Ua7FhZQAnx9JENLhzRVKg.text: Great, fun place. Good food. Nice atmosphere. Very reasonable prices. Good-sized portions. Highly recommend on a first date, spouse date or for a big birthday celebration.

m1KpEtfCbMXixWwEUY82pg.text: What a great place to eat in SW Las Vegas!  We live in the area and decided to visit the place once it opened.  We are very fond of the Hibachi style Japanese restaurants, and we were floored at the more-than-reasonable pricing!  Salad, soup, fried rice, vegetables and my shrimp all came out to less than $20!  It was tasty and the atmosphere is classy but fun.  I would highly recommend!

eCZm9dWpGQOW3nKLhTrVDw.text: We've been driving past this for over and finally decided to give it a go. Soo glad we did. Very nice interior and atmosphere. Excellent quick and friendly service. Food was great and the price was incredibly reasonable. Family friendly as well. Overall a great experience and will return often.

5GmivOkRuRcd-Epexiv46w.text: We try to go to this restaurant about every other month.  Everything is wonderful - food, service, atmosphere and the show they put on the Hibachi grill in front of you.  Keep up the good work.

7wA4HS98Z1YUQ0t7SArkSQ.text: Great food! Family friendly and service was awesome! Get off the strip and come here!

bzPNZ9ByUfBnAJjSqXfbTg.text: Our meals were very good. Atmosphere was a little loud to be able to have a conversation but very fun. Very good service.

_hIXEmZwbMwgGoLzt4-yxQ.text: My wife and I absolutely love this place!  The hibachi is one of the best in Vegas and the prices are so affordable for the quality of food you receive. From the delicious soup and unique but delicious salad to incredible cuts of meat this place  rocks! Good luck finding a better filet mignon for anywhere near the price. The sushi has got to be my favorite that I've had. It is quite a bit more expensive than some of the more mainstream sushi spots, but too compare them to places like sushi mon would be an insult. They use super fresh cuts of fish and not even the seaweed has that nasty typical sushi flavor. It's really a demonstration on how sushi SHOULD be done. Another thing to keep in mind is the fact you are getting more than food at this hibachi and the show is always amazing no matter which chef you get. Some are funnier than others, but I enjoy getting a different routine every now and then. If you choose to eat the hibachi I strongly encourage to buy a round of sake bombs! It's a blast for you and your friends and surprisingly smooth. I eat here whenever I have an opportunity and it comes highly recommended. I'm currently trying to convince myself to spend the money and get the Kobe beef! Looks delicious!

dJHF0i-FOJ57d_MnV1TVPw.text: Great Hibachi and Pad Thai! Staff is friendly, nice, and quick.  Great neighborhood atmosphere.  Live hibachi style seating or just sit in the front for a quick bite.  Food is always fresh and delicious.  I completely recommend this little hideaway.  It has become one of our favorite places to eat.  Thank you!

zGDG77YK1u9sWMnVOoAbTA.text: Why is everyone voting 4 stars?? haha.  this place is awesome, I've been here more then 5 times.  They have a great deal which is like 3 rolls for 23 dollars or so(specialty rolls) and that should be more then enough for yourself depending on the roll.  I have never been to the hibachi but I'm sure thats good too!.  and the waitresses are cute too!  ;).

37x8umPpA4TaAKaAo2H5Pg.text: we visited ohjah for the first time on my bf's bday. we got to the restaurant at around 6:30pm and there was not a lot of people at the place so we were seated right away. our waitress was polite and friendly. since it was our first time at the place, she explained to us how hibachi works. she is very knowledgeable about everything on the menu and answered all our questions. she suggested which was good to try, and we did, and they were really good and tasty. overall, the food was great, the services was perfect. the chefs are funny and very entertaining. they know their way on knives and food. the price was very reasonable. the place was also clean and neat.

d149TeJBXcoUAY13eVyPcw.text: If you enjoy tepan grills this place is worth checking out. Food is always delicious and servers always entertain, regardless of age. Their sushi is fresh and tasty. There are certain rolls I love (like the Blue Diamond Roll, YUM!) and others I'm not particularly a fan of, but that's more a matter of taste rather than quality. The tepanyaki is delicious. I've had the chicken, steak, and shrimp with fried rice --- SO GOOD! I also appreciate that when I come here with a group of friends or just my boyfriend they'll allow me to sit at the grill if I only wish to order sushi. Granted, most of my visits have been during their slower times but I still very much appreciate that they offer it. My only complaint is that every time I visit, slow or busy, I have a very difficult time getting a second refill from my server. This only really bothers me because I can be with one or two others who get three or four refills and I will have to flag them down to ask for one. Nonetheless I always come back because their prices are really competitive and the food is phenomenal.

jdQ2kCLPpCAagMXzWWdd6g.text: We went to dinner here last night with our two small children, ages 3 and 5, and were pleasantly surprised. They treated the children great, and they loved the little chopstick holder that made it possible for them to eat with. The food was great and very reasonable. The only complaint is their onion soup is so-so, but all the other food and service made up for that. We will back very soon

0ytQ2ZYxuVi_kfxLGtfeUw.text: There are places here that is hard to find awesome customer service and I finally found it here!  I came here for my birthday with my 2 young daughters age 8 and 4.  We did the Hibachi and we all had a great time.  My kids eyes were glued staring at the chef thats how good and fun he was!  They didnt know it was my birthday until the guest on the side of us asked if it was my birthday and then my waiter heard about it and asked me if it was bday?  Next thing you know, the lights dimmed and flickered and a birthday song came on and they also sang Happy Birthday!  The food, the service and the atmosphere is absolutely amazing! This is now my new spot because the number one reason:  The Service was beyond A+!  Thank you Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse and Hibachi!!!  And the food was excellent!!!

63mkYBe-uiIuDpxEdYbTXQ.text: bomb..bomb.. .always great food, funny chefs, one of my favorite spots..i always get 3 item filet, shimp, and scallops..yumm..

c60T5UnMNDCB6F8-QY7u8g.text: I really love this place, and am sad I didn't know it existed until a couple of months ago. It's got everything going for it. The ambiance is beautiful, the waitstaff is friendly and eager to please, and the food it amazing. It's also very reasonably priced for the quality of food they offer. Ever since Nagoya closed down I've been looking for a good replacement. This place is even better than Nagoya in my opinion. I haven't tried the hibachi portion of this yet, I've only sat down for dinner but I'm willing to bet it's a positive experience.

S_WX6g4VS0h2AcK7pJueug.text: Too good, plain and simple.  I've been going to Benihana for as long as I can remember and Ohjah is right up there with the big boys without the high ticket price tag.  The hibachi is freaking awesome, not to mention they have great sushi deals too...must try "The Boat", still haven't gotten a chance but it is a sushi display of pure beauty.  The service is always so friendly and quick, they always make sure you have what you need and they encourage that you check-in for your free house sake.  I absolutely love that Ohjah opened up five minutes away from where I live and that I don't need to get dressed to the nines to go there.  Love it!

CJj5V9NyJO01alwxDzyrxw.text: I highly recommend that you pick the restaurant instead of the tepankayi where they put on a show and cook infront of you. The quality ofmthe food on the restaurant side is amazing and very delicious. The other side , on other note, tasted like it was smothered with MSG. You pay for the entertainment thats why it's so expensive. The servers were very nice except for the manager. It was the third time I ate there and it was a little busy than usual. I saw the manager cussing and giving attitude at the servers and COSTUMERS! He was so unprofessional! Other than that, food is great!

AZP54K5pzezvkSufnpyX3A.text: Goodbye dinner for Hiroki had to include sushi! Awesome night. Awesome friends. Awesome food. Sorry we couldn't get oysters. Next time, and there will definitely be one!

8n3qkILTEWA_1YteS8vvcQ.text: I don't usually give 5 star ratings but in this case, I have no problem doing so. the staff are friendly and very attentive to the customer. the hibachi chef (tom) was a riot and a real entertainer. He made the whole experience one to remember so ask for him when you go. the food is top notch and I recommend the filet and shrimp. the food was fresh. the filet Mignon literally melts in your mouth. the appetizers of shrimp/calamari/vegetable tempura was fantastic and not too heavy. I have been there twice now and plan to make it one of my regular spots to eat. Both my dinners were just wonderful and the staff are top notch and have a way of making you feel at home. just a wonderful place to dine. Oh, I almost forgot, the prices are extremely reasonable for what you get. I cant think of one thing I would change about Ohjah except that I wish one were in Henderson so I wouldn't have to drive as far to get to it. But hey, one cant have it all. Its well worth the travel though. A must dine experience that one will not forget.

-9X5koMIi-KQhst5ZG9lnA.text: Sushi was good & so was the food. Decent pricing. Not my number 1 sushi place but heck of a lot better than any more easy of Nevada!

XXjIW0qSOnFnhSKvhkAszQ.text: Chicken Yakisoba was so-so but the sushi and teriyaki beef made up for it by far.  I'm already thinking about whether it's unreasonable to go back two days in a row just for the Shogun roll.

w82KfywSd_1d9Oo_bNZrng.text: First time here tonight and everything was so wonderful. Came as a party of 8 and didn't know what to expect. I was confused to how to order at first but the waitress explained how the habachi worked.  The chef we had that cooked our food was hilarious and joked with me a lot.   Food was just delicious. And the service we got from all the staff was amazing. I believe the manager even came around to see if everyone was happy and doing good.  They even brought out a cake for the birthday girl that was with us.

JQfS7uiz1QUgo9ot8h64Bw.text: This is a very fun place to enjoy a nice dinner. We sat at the teppanyaki area and the food was prepared very well and we got some great entertainment as well. Our chef was a bit of a comedian (in a good way) and me made our experience a very pleasant one. This location is pretty empty during weekdays so I've never needed a reservation.

8kvEqiCBZIc1x028V79ptQ.text: Great service! They were able to do hibachi gluten free for me and followed all the proper etiquette, which is always nice to see and not have to ask for. Food was great!

54LzerskWQPlrE1cePCXIg.text: This place is awesome! Have family and friends visiting from out of town and have never been disappointed. Every time they come into town they want to go back there. The chefs are fun to watch and funny. The food is excellent with lots of flavor.

6cMhGnshDIEMYBxdNpNWyw.text: I can only speak for the hibachi side. I LOVED IT. We each ordered the combination with filet mignon, shrimp, scallop and calamari. My boyfriend had the fried rice and I had the fried noodle (chow mein).  I would just like to say it was so delicious and melts on your mouth!  We loved our chef and our food, but whilst eating dinner a check gets dropped off then 5 minutes later the manager checked if we paid.   Although I understand that maybe as hibachi tables stand, there's another group of people coming in, we still felt rushed and needed to get out. We were there to celebrate and to drink with really great food, but we were cut short. I hate feeling like we're being rushed out, especially when dessert wasn't offered. Because we felt like we needed to clear out, we didn't even get to look at the dessert menu again, and I wanted dessert! I mean, we were celebrating. We would've ordered another round of drinks with dessert, but wasn't given the chance and that is the only complaint.

qv5bdG5ijq3I4FzMe82rig.text: This place is amazing. The seafood is fresh and the flavors are amazing! It's definitely my go to sushi restaurant!! The service is always great!

bSlZ5gzugUO7BFtJFakBNw.text: Went here Feb 27th, 2016. It was awesome. My mom was out for a visit from Ohio and want to take my niece and I out for dinner. They have great prices, great service, & great entertainment. Food was so good. I will be back.

0135YZmVHzezvlxdWwtmoA.text: Great spicy ramen and gyoza. More seating in the restaurant than most ramen places and well staffed. Quick food with great quality.

h0kfN48zAZ7JobUy1YybNg.text: Another place I thought I write/wrote an extended review but then, poof ! Nowhere to be seen then I get a little note from yelp saying, hey, you took some pics, how about writing a review.  Well, I am frustrated by the lost lengthy review so I will keep this one brief.    Went in for late lunch with the gf.  Mistaken impression that hibachi meant it was bbq'ing meats on a lil hibachi either self serve or cooked to order.  Told it was basically teppan style AND not available until evening.   Not happy.  Went ahead and ordered some sushi, soup and a few other unremarkable items.  Nothing stood out for either of us.  No plans to return   pics posted ages ago

fd0nM9bP0dgiw7VTuRsciw.text: Came here when it was about 30 minutes before closing. We told the host stand we'll just get it for togo but the manager insisted we stayed. We knew we were gonna get mediocre to okay service.. BUT NO! we got a horrible service. never coming back again.

IS9EeAkme9jgBDzRgkdd_Q.text: I can't believe I went to this place as many times as I did before trying out the Hibachi grill. It's AWESOME. The food is great and I love the service. For my husband and I, it's our go-to place for date night!

GH1OLhfX6_I9eSs8vkFMng.text: Absolutely disgusting!   I got the worst food poisoning from their disgusting fucking fish and they charged my credit card twice! Their prices are high for shitty sushi, and the ambience is depressing on top of that.  If you like fishy underhanded staff and fish that will make you vomit, eat here. Otherwise I suggest you don't touch it with a 10 foot pole.

jVQqFPpFCp-zlWay-990Hg.text: It's so funny, that I couldn't remember eating here! It took me a bit to remember which is sad because I did enjoy the meal! I came here with friends, Erika T and Aileen, after a day of shopping at Primm. I ordered the tako (octopus) and it was delicious. The lobster roll tasted nice but it fell apart. (I think it was too drowned in sauce). The salad was ok, I prefer a ginger dressing that tastes like ginger. The service was good, the prices are good too. I'll come back for sure, if I am in the area. It's alittle far from where I live for me to be a regular.

Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunch roll in back and spicy crab and avocado wonton

_9wbTWDYwIyEconyU4A8xQ.text: Honestly best sushi restaurant in the Southwest area. Every time I come here I get quality sushi: delicious hand rolls, rolls, and sashimi. The staff have great customer service too!!! I've been to sushi restaurants around Chinatown where the restaurant staff were meh. I really recommend trying this restaurant if you're around the area.

qcDWW08QB8XKFe8n0S9Meg.text: Food is very good and priced reasonably, large portions, the 3 combo is the best value, we got the filet and ny steak with scallops

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iron chef over here

q6DQcqmZiCiNwKieSJdWMQ.text: Went in for sushi with the family. Ordered 4 rolls, the squid appetizer (can't remember the name, kushi something), and the chicken yakisoba. The rolls came out right away. The kushi took about 45 minutes, and the yakisoba over an hour. The rolls were good and so was the kushi, but unfortunately when the yakisoba finally came, I couldn't eat it, it came with the paper from a straw in it. Had it come from my straw, I would've eaten it, but I was unsure where it came from, as it didn't come from our table.  We received a discount and the dish was removed from our check, but after an hour I was really looking forward to trying it. May not be returning.. As for the service, saw waiter a few times in the hour and 45 minutes we were there, but only received one update on the length of time for the yakisoba and kushi.

Xqqqphsk9yMFIHFBG7l9XQ.text: Our little girls (6 and 8) love hibachi. It is their favorite dinner request. We eat sushi or hibachi at least once or twice a month so we were excited when we heard about Ohjah. The atmosphere is fun and exciting. The staff is extremely attentive and quick with any request. I would recommend this restaurant just for the service.   Now on to the food. All of us ordered the hibachi with the starter (soup and salad). It was delicious. The girls offered off the kids menu and we ordered off the adult menu. The portions and price are perfect for our family. Reasonable for the amount of fun that we had and the food was delicious.   The girls already asked to have their birthday celebration here. The staff does a little something special for the birthday boy or girl. We witnessed 4 birthdays during our dining experience. Fun times!

k9xY_dhk1YDcjthPoxAO4Q.text: Nice atmosphere and good food. The entertainment is great. Something different and exciting for a night out. I had the filet and it was cooked perfectly.

aF-U455RCOBQUbgJHgZviw.text: This was our second time here. We went in when they first opened.  We were not impressed then.  But tonight we wanted to get out & after checking Yelp we decided to give it another try.  They are located within walking distance of our house.  WOW! I'm so glad we went back! Fantastic food. Ambiance was great. Service was very good. We had Hibachi style. Sat with a blended family with 4 kids. We had a ball. Entertained by these kids.  Back to the food. I had Filet Mignon & hubby had a Lobster Tail. We shared. Fried rice & veggies. Yum! Yum! All I can say is go. Inexpensive, good service & Fantastic food!!! We will be back!

CLLX3xp9N0FJTDV8UQ2ufw.text: We had great service, great selection . Great presentation of great tasting food for great price. We had about 7 rolls of sushi, 2 big bowl combination fried rice, 1 beer and 4 soft beverages,  a miso soup. 5 of us got FULL! Only $90  I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great service, great taste, great presentation for great price!

RwuB--GyFMRfaHNqa52XrQ.text: I like the food at this place. It's not the best hibachi I've ever had but also not the worst.  I would call it good. It happens to be the only hibachi close to our house.  There are better places that are further away. I have no complaints about the food or the service.  They've always treated us good.    The reason I gave it 3 stars is the method they use for sitting people. The place has never been slammed. There are always hibachi tables open.  For example tonight it is 6:03 and they have two entire hibachi tables open and one that is finished and paying for their food, yet they are not taking walk ins.  They will put you down for a reservation in 30 minute increments.  So they won't sit the open table for 27 more minutes.  So I told them we would wait for the 6:30 reservation and that is when they told us we were the 1st on the 6:30 reservation list.  Haha so they won't sit us at any of the open tables because they reserve them for reservations but there was no one on the reservation list for 6:30 until we made a reservation.   We'd come here allot more if they were better at seating people. It's a shame.

OgR3uznVzJBNrh0W1IJVbg.text: We came in for a party, there was 12 of us that night. The guy who took our drink order and checked on us toward the end was extremely nice, very soft spoken and always smiling.  Our party did the Teppan side and I ordered one roll but mostly teppan all night. So we were mostly taken care of by the teppan man. Before everything started, they served us with drinks salad and soup.  Salad was pretty good, but I don't recommend the soup... As we finished our cook came by and no introduction really. Just verified our orders and how we wanted it. It was a rough start with him.. but as time passed he started to open up and make the kids laugh.  As for the food, it was all good. The fried rice, fried vegetables, salmon, and steak. He made it right in front of us, how we like it and all, and overall we all enjoyed it.  There was a spill that happened at our table and the teppan man tried to wave down a server but no one came by till I was already finished cleaning up the mess for my niece. The lady who stopped by just stood there waiting for the teppan man to tell her, there's a spill. I had to point it out and even give her dishes that were stacking up at our table.  I get it, it's auto gratuity but I would've rather given that to the chef and the really nice guy who helped us whenever he had the chance.   Not a bad place, but not 100% wonderful.

Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad

JO8dQ8U1lg19ICNL666sIw.text: The menu is huge, but had to come here for the hibachi menu. I recommmend coming here with the most, a party of 13 like what we did. It's a great place for birthdays! I feel that surrounding yourself with the people you know, it'll make the experience less awkward for you and the tapanaki chef.   I also suggest coming here when you have friends or family visiting. They'll love every part of it. Get the scallops with an extra squeeze of lemon, filet mignon medium rare, the fried noodles YUM, and ask about the dressing for the salad because it was really savory.   The pricing is reasonable. Don't forget to tip your chefs! The staff is also very friendly. You can reserve before hand! ;)

zPkSxFjD4n97G2TfZkzWjw.text: I still remember when they were building this  place, we were so excited to try it.  As a matter of fact, the first day they opened, we went and boy the fambam was so happy we did.  We've been going ever since.   When I used to live by it,  we'd go almost once a week. Now that we've moved further away,  we only go on special occasions but definitely a must for my 11 year old on every birthday he has so far.  We actually prefer it here than Benihana; better customer service, food, and prices.  We normally opt for the hibachi side of the restaurant and we just add sushi once in awhile.  The Ono (super white tuna) is just melt in your mouth goodness.  Can't go wrong choosing either garlic noodles or fried rice or you can get both!  Ask and you shall receive here :)  I just wish parking was better.

_7J8D1tsvkeZ7vlLBSzOGA.text: The sushi at this place is killer. For $25 we were able to get 3 rolls which 2 of us shared. The waitress was awesome, she worked with us on our order as we were very indecisive. She never got irritated and just helped us.   The sushi quality was great. Presentation was great. But the best part was the taste, it was all super tasty and not 1 roll tasted the same. Oftentimes when I eat sushi, although it tastes pretty good, it generally all taste about the same and becomes this boring monotony. So I was pleasantly surprised to have such a good experience!

XAzKeUcPS8A0f3l2Aa6o2g.text: Excellent sushi is all I can say. We sat at the sushi bar because we weren't wanting hibachi style food. The chef took our orders and handed them to us. I like it that way better because you don't have to wait on the waitress. The chef made me a special salmon roll, and it was exceptional. My son and I had several rolls and we loved it. This is going to be our new Vegas sushi spot when we're in town. Keep up the good work.

xEEHxFL-gM0xRtFyYb_p5w.text: I loved this place !! We had a great waiter too who made everything so fun. I got the shrimp and fried rice it was so good. Wait wasn't bad either.  For soup, salad, fried rice and entree it was like $18.

cbi2qkTJTJB04EezN2O7HA.text: Excellent food. Had the Combination, the usuals(Soup, Rice or Noodles, Salad, Veges) and 3 entree meats $34 Wife had the usuals with lobster tail $18. MrfFTntfgiEm84axUO4wpg.text: Bad service! Came in last night with my family and 5 year old niece for Hibachi.  The old Hibachi asian man who prepared the food made my niece cry as he was preparing the food! He kept saying "this is Ohjah I am the chef, eat your rice or else I take you home, you respect me". Overall, if you see a bald old asian man with a strong japanese accent who works there on a thursday night, leave and go home.  Bad service

5lTYfG6dJG1HMg3wzJ3Hmg.text: My husband and I visited Ohjah last night for the first time and it was the best hibachi I've ever had. The prices were very fair and our server was attentive and friendly. btzkkqwp0DYiLd1hIgMMrA.text: Ate here for the first time and it was good . Very full and the atmosphere was ok with little rooms you can sit in with just your group . BTtKgfAe7mmO0yNA5-Ntqw.text: We have visited this location several times.  The food is usually really good along with the ambiance.  I see some of the Chefs trying to put on a "fun" cooking expedition and a few others that have become very robotic.   The main reason I'm writing this review is because the manager, who has been there every time, NEVER smiles,  NEVER says thank, NEVER checks on our table and NEVER does ANYTHING to try to earn future business.  He has seen our family on MANY occasions as we our usually 6-8 guests at a time and is simply RUDE! There's so many other Japanese Steak houses to get great food in Vegas.  I think it's time we take our business elsewhere to feel appreciated for supporting a local restaurant instead of going to the hotel resorts. Very Frustrated!

Ozb9K640jI4fNEOQ5SHLow.text: I love this little local restaurant. I have been to another location and this one multiple times and have not left disappointed. They offer sushi at the sushi bar or anywhere in the restaurant and I find it to be of great value and excellent quality.  The rolls are large and filling, definitely worth grabbing if you stop in.  I also recommend the teppanyaki style dining, it is extremely affordable and is of much better quality and appeal than any of the large competitors like Benihana's or other teppan style restaurants in town. If you want to avoid the teppan, you can just grab an entree off the regular menu. We have tried many of the different options and all of them are greatly priced and extremely filling. Many times me and my wife will just split an entree and some rolls and leave their over filled with left overs. If you're ever looking for some good Japanese, I highly recommend it.

IkAxbt-wzlb5m5qW5DGO_A.text: I really enjoyed this place. Its very typical of what i expect from a Japanese Steakhouse and Hibachi room. They also had sushi and a limited thai menu making it great for a large group with varying tastes. They didnt do Hibachi at the normal tables which I found a bit shortsided. Many friends like Hibachi but they dont like the smell their clothes take on. Overall, the service was very on point, prices were very reasonable, food quality was very good. The filet I had was good, but not the highest quality. The chef cooking was alot of fun. Had a few new tricks I haven't seen. Another must visit destination.

mZtvnUxm3z5NK0rcTzLUBw.text: Great little place in Southwest Vegas off Blue Diamond.  Great hibachi.  Think, juicy meat sauteed just perfectly.  Real good sushi rolls as well.  Can't go wrong with this place either way whether you choose hibachi, japanese entrees, or sushi.

6RmLrkfyirZ_cMOlUQcc-w.text: Just finished our dinner here and made this one of faves for taking out of town friends and family to.  We were warmly greeted by the host and seated immediately in the teppan grill room, which appears to seat about 60-70 at six different stations.  They call it a "hibachi" dinner.   If anyone has ever eaten at Benihana's or the Nijo Castle (Newark, CA), I recall paying about $25-30 per Teppan entree.  Here, you pay $8.95 for the Hibachi basics: soup, salad, rice (steamed or fried) or fried noodles.  Then you choose your add ons or what they call "mix or match" which is your proteins.  Chicken teriyaki is $4.95, NY steak is $5.95, filet mignon is $7.55, shrimp $5.75 and so on,  There is also salmon, $5.75 scallops ($7.55),  Lobster tail (6 oz.) for $15.95, Kobe beef $48.95.  They also offer 3 basic entree items (not included is the lobster tail, Kobe beef or Halibut) + the Hibachi basics for $28.95.   I ordered the scallops and chicken, the wife, steak and it is still cheaper than other similar restaurants.  The quality of the food is good. Portions were decent.  The soup was mild in flavor, the salad though was disappointing. The dressing was watery and you could tell the salads were pre-made earlier in the day.   Pre-tip for our family of four with 2 kid's hibachi entrees (steak & chicken) with sodas and  a large Sapporo was $76.  They do offer lunch. sushi, sashimi, nigiri, and a good selection of Japanese entrees in their regular dining room, which has a sushi bar.  We're hoping this restaurant stands the test of time and continues to flourish at its location since there is no other restaurant like this in the SW part of town,  They also have a location in Pahrump.

AHm4FkbWpvqXSndJLj4KYQ.text: Best locals hibachi place Ive been to in vegas. Great prices service and food.

4urpzSHSCyPORHVEYA50Bw.text: This was the best meal I've had in a while and we eat out a lot!! The food was amazing!! The service was great! All around we were greatly entertained!!  First of we opted for the Hibachi and I am so glad we did! My fiance loves sashimi so he ordered the blue fin tuna, I do not really care for the raw stuff only in Miami and LA did I actually enjoy it!! Well I am addicted, that blue fin tuna was so so yummy. He ended up ordering another. For six dollars you get two healthy servings and it melted in my mouth with deliciousness! I am sold that is something  that  I will order again and again! My fiance got the trio Hibachi he chose the filet, the scallops and sole!! I ordered the lobster tail. The star for both of us was the sole! It was all delicious but we are still dreaming about that sole!! The filet was yummy and so were the scallops and the lobster but that sole was so memorable and unexpected because I love lobster but the sole was so freaking amazing! By the way my fiance thought the lobster was awesome, too! I was not in the mood for sake bombs but my girlfriend that was with us never had one so we decided to get some beer and sake to have sake bombs but the Hibachi chef told us they offer  sake bomb individually which is perfect! Well after the first round we got about 4 more rounds! It was so entertaining the way they do it! We had a blast! The noodles, the soup, the rice, the veggies all so delicious and tasty I had to control myself. Jack was our Hibachi chef and was awesome!! They made us feel so welcomed. My fiance can chug like no other so they kept giving bigger glasses of beer to try to beat him in the sake bomb challenge, they failed!! Super super night definitely be back again and again! I have already recommended this place to so many! I am so glad to have this place so close to my home Southern Highlands. We like to stay close and anything like that is xtreme sushi! We never feel comfortable and welcomed there and they have some good but a lot mediocre. So this will be our regular spot hope they stay because they are so great and in this economy where people are usually staying home it helps if you treat people right, plus I'd be heart broken if the service was bad because the food was so outstanding!! The whole combo works hope they keep it up and last!

W57mwlkw59JuXeOXPYZcOw.text: Great sushi.  Though not all you can eat.  The Holy Moly appetizer is AWESOME

DjXVuBSP0IzkuK8cOUg9lQ.text: Been to the hibachi twice, so I can't comment on the sushi bar.  The service is great and the food is even better. Try the scallops, they are excellent.

--p5RQKELs3x7T0YEWcVCQ.text: New japanese restaurant in the southwest part of LV. Bf and I came out here and were very pleased. FWircpgj3dv471Rzg8V-2g.text: Great service and amazing hibachi. Went there last night for dinner and was really surprised with this place. hGRpqaTfpQxP4B21u8Pw6A.text: REVIEW for SUSHI not HIBACHI.  This place was really good. I wanted to make sure I wrote a review because it's somewhat off the beaten path in a small "strip mall" area next to a liquor store. Place could be easily missed.   Tried several items on the menu (some lunch special). For 2 people, 2 apps., 2 miso soups, and 3 sushi orders - came to about $40 w/tax. For apps, had the chicken skewers. It wasn't that bad, but it was bland. I knew to stick to seafood.  The miso was good not too salty. The only roll I can recall the name of is the "Valintine" (sp?)  I'm not certain if it's because they're new, but having a website would be helpful, especially because they deliver. Overall, the place was clean, service was quick, and food was tasty.

WhiMZydvIS3wTx8hd3Bigw.text: Christmas Eve dinner. Yippee.Food was just OK. No return. Had Tempura. It was cold and greasy. Dip was gross. Husband had chicken and beefskewers of some sort. He eats anything and wasn't happy. Service weird and no one in regular restaurant. Teppanyaki was busy. This is our punishment for going somewhere weird on Christmas.

WR03JDnpwavQOGEeujlfkw.text: Not bad for a new restaurant! Steak teriyaki portion was pretty generous.

6CRJn-isbrlCoazInQf3Uw.text: Great new dinner option for people in the Southern Highlands area. Great sushi but there is no all you can eat. The hibachi is super affordable compared to some other local places and just as good if not better.

-aZ9LtwviAvL4LZByQZMDA.text: I LOVE the food here, especially the buttery fried rice at the hibachi grill.  Everything I've had there is good and service is good.  Though I would like to give them 5 stars, I'm giving only 2 because they were shut down by the health department and featured on channel 13 news Dirty Dining recently.  I'm going to wait until I'm not grossed out anymore before I go back.  But I'm guessing I will be back.

x2vFrGTlVp_HEGvyNdU1Tw.text: Like most of the reviews, the Southern Highlands area really needed a good Japanese restaurant as the area is pretty barren for choice.  Luckily Ohjah opened up in the discreet and empty strip mall across from Albertsons.  The first thing I noticed while entering the place with my wife was the Chinese conversation going on between the hostess and a chef.  Being from Hong Kong, it was a bit of a downer considering we were aching for some quality Japanese food, and seeing the place was ran by Chinese, our expectations immediately dropped.       The decor inside is very nice, the lighting is very good, and the staff very polite.  We ordered two lunch sets, the steak teriyaki for myself, and the wife had a steak stir fry.  The waitress tried selling us sushi ( she counted six times throughout our lunch), which seemed ok if we were the least bit interested.  The salad was cold to the point of almost too cold to eat, they need to keep it out of the fridge before serving, but the dressing was decent and could have been worse.  The miso soup is mundane, which probably came in packages you could get at Albertsons or Whole Foods.  The steak teriyaki and stir fry were pretty good, although the tray they brought the food out with smelled of bleach...  Yeah  All in all, it's a decent place.  We just had too high of expectations, thinking a nice Japanese family was setting up shop, only to see frozen to fryer type food.  The real biter is the price, which makes sure we won't be visiting again.  I want to love this place, because it's so close and it's Japanese, however I can't.  I would say to try it though, it's something different in the Highlands area, and it's at least worth a shot.

V1acyZoMrvWX4rpx-mNcqA.text: Giant sushi boat! It was wayyy too much food for 2 people. The 3 rolls (dynamite-sort and 2 simpler options) were great, sea weed salad was delish, but sashimi was not fresh and wayyy too thickly cut. Nice, attentive service.

nIieFCryjOJDOY2mvIYWUg.text: Fantastic hibachi! You have to order the basic first - which comes with onion soup, salad, and your choice of fried rice, steamed rice or noodles. That in itself runs about $8.95. Next you add on your choice of meat, fish, shrimp, scallops or lobster - these prices vary from $4.95 - $49. I ordered the teriyaki steak and it was phenomenal! My friend ordered the New York steak and he thought it was amazing as well. We also ordered saki with our meal, 2 large Saporo's and for dessert mango mochi. It was a ton of food and drinks, and I think we spent about $80 with tip for the chef and waiter. Our chef was funny and entertaining. Great experience and we will definitely be going back! Next time I will try the sushi and review.

K9Pjtqa4EKyQBT9w4mhfUQ.text: I come here often for the Snow White sushi roll and garlic edamame.  I have also been on the hibachi side, and had the calamari, which was excellent.,  The food and price are very reasonable. Usually not a long wait for dining in, if any.  The only trouble I have ever had is when I order by phone for take out, there have been a couple times I called 20 minutes prior to arriving, and still had to wait another 15, even though they said it would be ready in 15 minutes from the time I called.  Not sure where the issue lies with that one.  Still, they are apologetic through the waiting process, but it has happened more than once.  On the other hand, no complaints about dining in.

8ZDtjEIuMHLoFRHgUZzQzA.text: Love love love this place!! The food is so good and it's so affordable you just can't beat it!! It's a perfect place for celebrations or dates!  My family and I go often!

KtBQKrdTnK9MveFkTfMJIA.text: My boyfriend and I decided to try this place on a limb from yelp recommendations and I'm so glad that we did! The food is delicious! And is very reasonably priced. w2NeilCY7Z_Q5B1Bs_qVMQ.text: This place was great. The hibachi was pretty decent for my first time. Customer service was awesome there are some pretty cool people that worked there. Food was amazing and I had the fried ice cream for the first time too ughh melted in my mouth lol the price actually isn't too bad either. You'd think it would be more expensive than it is.
