S8TX3p5-zxjkymFFRgjpHQ.text: By far my favorite Japanese Steakhouse! The rice is perfect, not too salty. Everything here is just right. Prices are reasonable, too. Skip Geisha and Benihana, Ohjah is the place to go!

wHdm8SE97sOAYwo00VRYBg.text: Family and I tried this restaurant for the first time! It was nearby and decided to try. Comforting atmosphere, great server(PETER) plus he also ordered for us since we didn't know what to try first. Great sushi! I am definitely going back!

J0sa3PsqteC5PyIAUzCXBw.text: I love this place. It is fairly new and serve sushi and hibachi mostly. I have been there for both lunch and dinner (hibachi and regular dining) with my husband. The garlic edamame sets this place apart for me. The food is fresh and tasty. The hibachi chefs are fun and entertaining. The servers are pretty good, but have had just a couple issues. Ordered an appetizer once and it never came. When I mentioned to the waiter to just cancel it because our food was just showing up, the appetizer then came. They ended up comp'ing it because of the mix up and I quickly forgave them. Great, clean atmosphere. Other dishes available for those who do not like sushi as well. I highly recommend it for the cautious and daring alike.

YMs22GukrkgofrVXC6IerA.text: Get the boat.  Seriously.  Get the boat.   I cannot push this more unless I were to kidnap you and take you to the restaurant and forcefeed you sushi.  And that's just wrong, and requires way too much effort.   So get the boat.   It's a platter (shaped like a ship) with all sorts of nom-nom-nom nigiri, sashimi, and your choice of three specialty rolls.  So, so good.  This is a shared plate, and you need at least two people (who are especially hungry) or, more wisely, four people.    I am a fan of the caterpillar roll, so inevitably this was one of my choices.  Tender eel, firm avocado, nicely packed rice, and tasty sauce - nom.    The service here was great too!  The server was a pleasant woman who was always ready with water refills (why ruin the tastiness of sushi with a competing flavor from soda?), and the sushi chef was ready to answer questions.   Oh yeah, bathrooms were spotless!   I will have to go back and investigate the hibachi side of the restaurant at a later date, as this review is only about the sushi.   But yeah, get the boat.

k7IrxtgHx0mDUMlT_yKI2A.text: Hibachi is the Medieval Time's of Japanese cuisine. Dinner AND a show? ok.  So this review is only based off the hibachi part of the restaurant.  We have to go back and try the standard menu.  The chefs are funny and engaging! Catch a shrimp in your mouth flipped with the spatula right off the grill! I was the only one on our table to try, everyone else just had it flipped on their plate; When in Rome! err Japan?  As part of the Hibachi grill menu you get:  1. Onion soup (nice little starter with light onion flavor).  2. Salad with ginger dressing (warning: they drown the salad in dressing, so maybe ask for it on the side; but I love the dressing so no complaints here) 3. Sauteed veggies. 4. Fried rice or noodles. 5. Your choice of protein. I recommend to spend a little extra and getting the Filet  over  the other steak cuts.  Even though I ordered my NY strip medium, because it was then sliced before plating it kept cooking more and came closer to well done.  The Filet was more tender and ordered medium-rare came to your plate closer to medium but Delicious! I enjoy a good surf & Turf so I also had the calamari which was just ok, Someone in our table ordered lobster and scallops.  The scallops looked amazing so I will try that next time, Lobster looked a little small but what can you expect from a Hibachi grill.  The rice was flavorful and the veggies were delicious, I love me some mushrooms.  (why was the mushroom invited to the party? Cause he was a Fun-gi!).    We definitely will return. The bill ran about $40-$50 for two. Not bad for a date night (don't worry, it was an impromptu date night, I'm no cheap date giver). The sig-other definitely enjoyed the experience and the food.  Did i like it? Oh-jah (oh-yea) I definitely did.  Horrible attempt of a pun. Sorry.

ogVQVn9f7JSD-pBsVpip9Q.text: I'll tell you I was nervous to have sushi in Vegas but it was as good as any I've had in Seattle. Clean, friendly and yummy! Get the boat! Its beautiful and deliciously fresh! Worth every penny!

A05zt8f9GVB2LQyc9pSIHA.text: I like coming here for their Sashimi. I'm so used to AYCE sushi that I compare it to Ohjah. So i only come when I crave Sashimi.Yum! They have Hibachi which I don't care for so the dining area is less busy.

FjfravB-IizEKovBBP458A.text: I been before and thought it was under priced, so today i'm taking a few friends with me. yeay

RRKG1sBdWsJ-ufWT9NAxrA.text: We went here for lunch on Sunday. The lunch box specials include Miso soup, salad, pot stickers, California roll, rice, and your "entree". My chicken teriyaki lunch box was under $7.00 so I expected the lunch box to be small. (I spend more at taco bell for a combo meal.) By the time I was finished with my meal, you had to roll me out of there! It was plenty of food! The decor is beautiful, the food tasted fresh and it came out relatively fast. HW9gCt4lV1Thd0W7e7UxIA.text: Food was amazing, service was great as well! Loved it the sexy mama roll, and the  Teppan was really good too! MskdRUnwWkOk5yUe--EX2A.text: Goodness. I never wanted to be that person that sits and complains about a place but I am feeling almost despondent about what happened to my family tonight at this Decatur location.  It was my little boys 13th birthday celebration and his father was there with his girlfriend and family and I was on my way to meet them for a 7pm reservation when his father texted me at 7:03 (I was six minutes late) and said "What do you want to eat? They are pressuring us to order NOW. I said "Can you please ask them to wait, I will be there by 7:06, I am 1 mile away" and both my son and his father were texting me back and saying, "they are being really aggressive about making us order now so we will just order for you."   When I got there and sat down, our cook then showed up with the food prep. Me being the kind of girl that always loves to engage with people, especially in customer service/interactive places like this, grinned at him and said "Yahhh.. Are you going to do some Magic for us tonight?" and then looked at my son to see him smile back.      The chef BARKED back at me with a scowl on his face saying " I DON'T DO MAGIC, if you want to see a MAGIC SHOW you go to the MGM GRAND! I cook!". Then he continued to go on and say a few more choice things. At this point I am flat out humiliated and said jokingly "Well I am sorry, I didn't realize it was such an insult to ask you if you were going to perform some magic for us".         There was NO SMILE on this man's face and no one at our table was smiling when he said these things.     He made me very uncomfortable the entire dinner and that In turn made my poor son uncomfortable.  Twice he slammed down his spatula ( part of the schtick I get it) but it kept scaring me and I would let out a little shriek and laugh and he would just scowl every time it happened.     Just a miserable experience. He was extra loud, aggressive and just so much negative energy.  Never smiled once.   Then they brought out the wrong cake for my son.   We had to remind them and so they brought out the one that we had bought and they sang Happy Birthday to him again, for the second time in a row. I joked to my son that he just aged a year in 5 minutes.   We had no sooner taken two bites of our cake when they started bringing out new plates and silverware trying to rush us out of there.  It was apparent they wanted to turn the table over and we felt very unwelcome so we rushed to leave.     I would not recommend this place to ANYONE.. EVER.   It's nothing but trying to get as many people in and out of there as quick as possible and they have NO respect for the fact that the customers may want to take a little time to enjoy the hundreds of dollars they just spent.    I am finding out the name of our COOK and calling to complain to the manager tomorrow. I am sorry but no one deserves to be treated with disrespect when they are spending their hard earned money in their establishment.

cVkgOFSMzf5wOJgN60fjSw.text: I can just now stomach writing this review, from the food I ate here on 12/25/2015. We have been to Ohjah a handful of times for their hibachi room. It has always been ok... Nothing great, and very greasy. The kids love the hibachi experience though, so we've gone for a couple of special occasions, because it's a bit pricy for what you get.  Christmas night, we finished family get togethers early, and thought it would be nice to grab a bite to eat. The places that were open were packed, so we eventually found ourselves here. We ate in the regular dining room. I ordered the salmon teriyaki. It was horrible. It tasted very fishy, and was so over cooked, that it was actually a challenge to chew.  Needless to say, I didn't eat it all.  Four hours later, I barely made it to the bathroom, and basically stayed there for the next two days. I was SO sick. My friend who is an ICU nurse had to come over and give me Zofran... This is the only thing that kept me out of the hospital, as I literally could not keep anything in me for a little over 48 hours. Merry Christmas to me! UGH.  Do NOT trust the food here. There's no need to pay for overpriced food, that can possibly send you to the hospital.

I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice restaurant.  The menu has many tempting choices for you to choose from. We had the Hibachi dinner with New York steak, lobster tail, shrimp, and chicken. They were all perfectly cooked and delicious.  Next time i plan to try the sushi too. HLGvx8pgno0BHisXk0zKVw.text: Weeks of enduring the heavenly aromas of teriyaki goodness sizzling away on hearty grills, wafting across the road every time I drove by this restaurant, are what brought me to Ohjah.  As the restaurant was being built, and when it finally opened, I remember thinking (with a raised eyebrow), "Another restaurant in a strip mall... hmm."  I'm very glad for the overly enticing smells coming from this place, otherwise, I may not have found one of my new favorite restaurants, and a True hidden gem.  Let me just say, right off the bat, that a prerequisite for working at this restaurant is to be one of the most genuinely nice and polite people on the face of the earth; I have never seen such friendly service... EVER.  We are greeted promptly and warmly every time we dine here.  The servers are always very attentive, and extra dishes are removed right away.  The restaurant is divided into two sections: the hibachi grill side, and the regular restaurant side (which includes a large sushi bar, booths, and tables).  Although I have only ever eaten on the regular restaurant side, I must say I will definitely try the hibachi side one day because of the sounds, smells, and action coming from that room are incredible!   The food is also incredible.  Some of the items we have had are: teriyaki scallops, tempura (vegetables and shrimp), numerous sushi rolls (the Black Widow is amazing!), nigiri, sashimi, miso soup, and the house salad.  All were equally delicious (and I'm finding myself strangely addicted to the house salad dressing -- it is mayo based and surprisingly light).  I did find the teriyaki scallops to have a bit too much of the "char" bits on them, but other than that, they were cooked perfectly, and the sauce complimented the flavor of the scallops very well.  The food is always fresh and delivered in a timely manner, and the plating is intricate, balanced, and inviting.  The prices are affordably appropriate as well.  I read in another review that this restaurant would be a great "first date" place to go, and I wholeheartedly agree (for the hibachi or the regular restaurant side).  The ambiance is very pleasant with simple and beautiful artwork on the walls, and low lighting, giving it a romantic feel.  At the same time, it is definitely a very family-friendly restaurant, and a great place to come with friends (especially with $2.50 sake bombs!).  Definitely give this restaurant a try when in Vegas, you won't be disappointed.  And if you live here in Vegas, and don't live close to this particular location, there are a few other locations in town (I have been to the Flamingo location recently, and if I were to review it, I would literally copy and paste this review in for that one as well).

eo-z8KMzgzzLcLZsgZ6iOg.text: My husband and I decided to check out Oojah the other night for a late lunch/early dinner. I loved the decor of the restaurant. Very nice looking! The staff was all very friendly and accommodating as well.   We made it in time to enjoy their lunch box specials, which were smaller and cheaper versions of their dinner boxes. I got the chicken katsu box while my husband got the beef teriyaki box. I couldn't believe the size of the boxes when they were brought to our table! Not only was my portion of the chicken katsu huge, but it also came with miso soup, salad, pork dumplings, and three California rolls (perfect because I am pregnant and can't have traditional sushi). The food was great and very filling!   I felt the prices were fair for what we ordered and even looking at the menu, the sushi prices I felt were reasonable as well.   We'll definitely be visiting Oojah again and I can't wait until I am able to try out their sushi!

dLW-eiK9khP_X3VqsCDshg.text: **Summary** - Ambiance - A little noisy, but the decor was nice. It was romantically lit with big screens over the sushi bar. A little something for both genders. - Owners - First Japanese restaurant that I've been to that had Chinese music playing. You usually see them owned by Japanese or Korean in Vegas. - Soup - They said the soup was onion soup, but I'm pretty sure it was winter melon. It's a pretty traditional Chinese soup. They said they also had miso. **Ordered** - $12.50 Unagi Don - A decent sized piece of eel as far as eels go. A tad dry, but not bad. It comes with soup and salad. Good for those who don't want a big meal. - $14.95 New York Steak Teriyaki - A fairly large steak cooked to your liking covered in teriyaki sauce. It also came with a crab rangoon, salad, and a soup. Definitely worth trying if you like steak teriyaki (yelp.com/biz_photos/sYfH...). **Recommendations** - I'd recommend this place if you live near Blue Diamond. It's a nice place to eat without having to drive too far.

N1OJ3n3rBJHVdwy3KIoVrw.text: One of the top meals I've ever eaten!  Along with outstandingly fresh sushi, authentic yakisoba, perfect vegetable tempura, and melt-in-your-mouth mochi, the service there was the absolute best I've ever experienced. I don't write many reviews but felt this place needed my mentioning.   Normally I research my restaurant options but yesterday we were starving and happened on this place so decided to chance it.   As soon as we walked in the door the staff rushed to greet us and then got down on the kids level and talked to them for a minute. Awesome! They were also very helpful and patient with our many questions about menu items and didn't seem irritated by our indecisivness.   We made our order and our rainbow roll was on the table within, not kidding, 3 minutes and was so SO fresh. As each dish was brought out and tasted, I was increasingly impressed. I wayyy overdid it on eating but the food was so worth it. The staff was very attentive and observant and when one of my girls started crying, they brought her over a small candy and talked to her.   They were very polite and rushed to the door to bid us goodbye as well.   We will be back for sure.

-TVCFQ-ARoEaBDemmlkV4g.text: I've been multiple times since they opened and will probably keep coming back. The people who work here are really friendly and that's always a positive! Their menu is really large so you're bound to find something you like.  I, myself like their sushi combos because you can choose 2-4 rolls from the menu (a deal on it's own), plus you get some pieces of nigiri sushi and some selected sashimi.  The price is decent also!  However if you do order one of these sushi combo platters and also plan to eat regular food off the menu (that's lots of food by the way), you should probably put in your sushi order first because they do tend to take a little longer to make these combos for some reason. I never tried the hibachi, but there's always lots of people in there so I assume it's pretty good.    All-in-all, this is a good neighborhood family restaurant and it's worth a try.

0jgPblR20mescHtw8A5MBw.text: Super bomb! Ordered the whole menu! Good prices too! Steak, filet mignonette, scallops, shrimp! Me and my friend ordered 5 items each and 2 sakes and the bill was $100. Not bad at all. They had to roll me out of there

iaAIq4sFLuD4iOtxn1IdgQ.text: Love this place!!! I have eaten here several times with friends and always had excellent service and great food. I always do the hibachi and my favorite is the Steak and Shrimp. The choices are excellent and they fix it to your preference.

TStCXQ9PvJsob50CdvI1Gg.text: SERIOUSLY great service. The hibachi space has adequate seating so you don't feel cramped. Plus I got free saki just for yelping.  The hostess was really nice. When I showed her my YELP check in, I think she got just as excited as I was. With the press of a button *poof* just like that free hot saki.   The chefs are great here. They are not just entertaining but they have a certain swagger when rocking those knives and spices. The entertainment factor alone made the night cool. The food was super good. All of the other reviews are 100% accurate. Everything just melts in your mouth. I was a little hesitant about getting the shrimp because previous reviews said it tasted too fishy or something like that. Im not sure if they made some changes or what, but it tasted fine to me. The 5 star factor here are the employees. We went here to celebrate a birthday and they made it really special. It wasn't just about the song or the dessert. They made the entire experience memorable. Ohjah ill definitely be back.

_nO4ItOpffTwoRLM_u_6YQ.text: We came here for the hibachi for our 6th wedding anniversary, and had a great time! Fun, friendly, good food, and entertaining. Friendly staff and fun filled atmosphere. We will be coming back again!

-MU4vNZEhyxGBiZ287598w.text: I love this place, the food is great and servers are friendly. I had my birthday dinner here and ordered their boat.....which I have to admit is worth the price. The sushi chef was also really cool he made us a  small dish of one of his specials for us to taste which was awesome. I highly recommend this place and will be here more often.

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TmDh3eUjv0sF32D-a1yeHw.text: Happily surprised! Clean, and nice set up! We did not eat on hibachi side, rather ordered off the menu. We had for appetizer the lasagna and Cali rolls, tempura dinner, chicken teriyaki dinner. Dinners came with miso soup and salad. Food was nice serving and try even had brown rice at not extra charge (nice)!   We will def come back! I got a gift card after for my parents....

Y93gStWadKzYOsioKmuo1A.text: For the best experience sit at the sushi bar and get to know the chefs.  They offer great sushi rolls with many to choose from.  The sushi boat is a great value and comes with so much stuff.  Staff is friendly and it's always clean.   The boba tea is very good here too.  Awesome uni when it's available.

beYQ7qz2hL-kDm4lMiSirQ.text: Each time I come here it reminds me of why I keep coming back. Great edamame, great teriyaki scallops!

-5Qbzm0Af7lEBs5fH12i1A.text: My husband and I love this sushi place so yummy!!!  Excellent customer service and kind people work here ;)

aK_8orLg0s51kvwLikF65w.text: Went with my colleagues (8 people) around 5PM and was seated right away. It took some time for the chef to show up but we didn't mind since we had our drinks and the free sake after checking in Yelp. I had the New York steak hibachi which was ok. Service was great but their sake menu was very limited.   Bottom line: great service, inexpensive, average food and limited sake options.

yfOjsOjYa3rmKH72n_lPWw.text: Great affordable hibachi for locals. I've been to Ohjah several times and thoroughly enjoy this place!  The grillmasters are entertaining as always (I still can never catch the shrimps in my mouth for the life of me) and the service hasn't disappointed yet.   I have tried the filet mignon, Sukiyaki beef, salmon teriyaki, and the scallops. The filet mignon is my absolute favorite, it MELTS in your mouth. Filet would definitely be my recommendation for first timers and meat lovers.  The portions are filling as with your main hibachi dish you also receive: onion soup (I request for miso soup instead), house salad, grilled veggies, and your choice of fried rice or noodles.  For those who live southwest or nearby, I definitely recommend trying out Ohjah if you're in the mood for hibachi!

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taking out the fire!
Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki salmon, grilled noodles &amp; veggies
Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming onion tower

8jqqnSK5ujWtnzbip-NEWw.text: I'm never disappointed with food here, and as long as you call in advance to see if there's a wait for teppanyaki... then you'll love it!  The menu looks a la carte for teppanyaki, but it's really a build on price. If you're not good at math, you can rack those prices up quickly! The chef was great and friendly, which is needed when you basically have dinner with strangers! Lmao   I'm not a fan of sake, but you'll get a free shot when you check in!  Tiger roll- spicy, of course, and you can taste the freshness!!!!  Yellowtail sashimi- fresh! I asked for jalapeno on mines and it was perfect

qQCvQkZoMYoQnylMi5drpQ.text: We tried the Hibachi Grill!  We came in on a Friday night with a party of 11 for a birthday party but they seated us in less then 5 minutes (reservations helped). All the seats at all 6 hibachi stations were maxed out.  Really impressed with how fast we got in there.  Most places even with reservations you still have to wait a little.  All of us ordered the three choice option at the grill which was a lot of food for under $32.  I did shrimp, calamari, and chicken with noodles!  Oh wee it hit the spot!  The ambience is fairly quiet until the chefs do their thing to entertain then the sound level spikes up, but that's the whole experience it's part of the fun.  My kids (8, 6, 5) haven't had a hibachi experience since they were babies so they finally got to enjoy it.  I checked in and got a free Sake!  Thank you for a great Friday Night!

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion Volcano!
Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp, Chicken and Calamari in the grill!

7bzCRYQKA_9h0A-SfqmfrQ.text: The serving sizes are huge. The servers are very  professional. We order the hibachi special for $31.95 which allows us to choose three meat items. I had the filet minon , Scallops and shrimp. Pricier items can be picked for an additional cost (Kobe beef, lobster...)  The place is clean and neat.  Each chef table can accommodate 12 guests.   The flavor of the food was average. The place is getting 4 stars from me because chef didn't seem to have the patience to entertain our toddler kids. Our only reason to eat at the place was so the kids can have a little fun. It looked to me like our chef would have spent more time if the guests were grown ups. I can tell that he has a "R" rated sense of humor.   Overall - the place offers good value.

8PJAQBnRtas1Y7kojaO4Hg.text: The most tasty dining I love their food, Atmosphere,and it's a delightful place to take your friends and family. The quality is great and the prices are reasonable. Everyone is happy to see you and it's a pleasant experience.

0a8pKqYDnJ9zVOtV22SCbQ.text: Hibachi food was very good.  But the hibachi cook was not very interesting.

3Qpmcdjm3kcs5TOKriugXQ.text: Oh, HELLOOOOOOO! Sail away with me...on their sushi boat!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  3 kinds of sashimi (sake, maguro, Hamachi) x 4 kinds of nigiri x 3 specialty rolls. We chose the Ohjah roll, Show Me the Love roll, and Cowboys roll. We tried to choose the most expensive rolls. OBVI.   Just having a boat full of sushi come out to you is (almost) like love at 1st sight. Especially when it's $40!

Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 kinds of sashimi x 3 kinds of specialty rolls x 4 kinds of nigiri #SushiBoat

TUaiS1bmvZCJMUbHnApWVA.text: We still love it here. We still ask for Van at Hibachi. Last night, we were starving at 7pm. Van wasn't available until 7:30. Although my I was ready to take any other chef, my kids all voted against me and said we should just wait for Van lol. We waited and finally ate a little after 8pm. Food was still amazing!

IPBenXcve3RdZbfW4GCFSA.text: Nothing impressive. It could have been much better but it wasn't. It was very ordinary. They did not give me a chance to relax and enjoy my drink before ordering. Felt rushed. Nice people and quick service. But too quick

kp8TWts8iwp_xoZ44eAp8Q.text: My favorite Hibachi! Food is always amazing! The chefs put on a great show! My kids love this place. We often come here on special occassions. It is a bit pricey but I believe you can share. I've also tried their sushi and the Blue Diamond Roll is my favorite. Cant wait to go again!

C49QG8afclJV8iGk2vkRyw.text: Sat at the sushi bar. No one else at the bar. Habachi room was busy so we were ignored and service was very rude when we did get a chance to order. We gave this place a shot. Won't come back

u3sHb53k_e8SJOLOWCOEaw.text: It is 12:20am I was in this establishment around 10:30 pm and since I got home I have not stopped peeing from my butt. I am intensely terrified to fart in fear of what might come out. I only had one sushi tool and a side order of fried rice.

VlXBSTJX66m-Fufn2XOp3g.text: There's a teppanyaki area and a regular dining area to eat sushi, Thai dishes, and other non-teppanyaki Japanese dinner entrees. I usually go to the teppanyaki side where you start with a basic hibachi entree which includes onion soup, house salad with ginger dressing, rice (brown, fried, or steamed) OR fried noodles, and veggies (carrots, onions, broccoli, and zucchini) for $8.95. The house salad with ginger dressing is good but the onion soup is a little bland and boring. Then you pick your choice of meat. I went with the NY steak (5 oz) for an additional $7.95. My steak was cooked perfectly. You also get two dipping sauces. The brown sauce is for the meat and the yellow sauce is for your vegetables. The prices are reasonable compared to overpriced Benihana.  No issues with service from the several times that I have went. I would only come here for the teppanyaki. I ordered the Ohjah Boat (rolls, sushi, and sashimi served on a wooden boat) on a previous visit. The sushi was meh and a bit on the warm side so I will just stick to the teppanyaki here. This is pretty much Benihana's but a lot cheaper where the chefs do their show with the flaming onion volcano, throw an egg in the chef's hat and split it with a spatula trick, & the chef throwing shrimp in your mouth act, etc. I'm not coordinated when it comes to that so I always decline politely. There are a lot of families with kids who like to come here so if you're one of those diners who hate kids, stay away or if you have kids, they would probably enjoy dinner with a show.

Vad3mpEMKB0bW7Ka4eN2CA.text: Great sushi at a reasonable price! Always stop here when in Las Vegas. Next time we will try the sushi boat!

OFKqvylTFClpuBlEhh-h0Q.text: The staff and food are great, but that birthday song they play "way too loud" gets so annoying when you are trying to have a conversation w/ the people you are having dinner with. Get rid of that annoying birthday song they play over the speakers and it would get five stars.

JSEb46YXAcOFnXfUd9G43w.text: Horrible service, horrible food  and the manager has absolutely no customer service and hardly speaks English! We won't be going back ever again!

HT3EqMCrrIWfSUZ7pv4xnw.text: Love love love it here! Sushi is kinda pricey but several options. But so worth the price! Teppan is great and entertaining! You won't be disappointed

TCxMtA3iILoP5WTtKgcF-A.text: First time coming here, my mom recommended this spot. Sushi was served really quick, Danny made me a special roll.  I gave them 4 stars just because the rolls are super tiny, they are still good tho.

hWSA9g4FRRsgK_Ue9SuhBQ.text: This is definitely my favorite steakhouse/sushi in Vegas. The sushi it top quality, the hibachi is amazing, the crew is nice and inviting. Definitely a 5 star establishment.

WCF4aUHEHYNQngW42fQQtg.text: Another quality meal from the team behind Ohjah. This is my second time at the restaurant and first at this location and the meal lived up to my prior recollections. Great service, lively cook, and a fun time all around. This time I went with the NY Strip and tried some filet from the person I dined with. This is actually very quality meat considering the price. Cooked exactly how I asked (medium rare) and seasoned tremendously. I am a True fan of the Ohjah experience.  For about $20 each you can really experience a hibachi themed meal here.

oULkVemN4oJesl54q-Wl3g.text: Food was amazing, service could be better and you cant beat the prices. $18 bucks an entree and $6 bucks for a cocktail is well in our budget! Will come again

GStCDgTo0OtwtRrp3jF9_A.text: Our group of 6 red heads gathered around, We had a lovely dinner and each of our special dietary needs were catered to.   The chef was awesome, he was fun and entertaining with every one of us. The chicken, steak and shrimp was all cooked to perfection, and our one girl who had sushi all raved about what they ate.   I would most certainly go back!

kyW3xoylR0SP5bJwMBXvfw.text: We went with my 4 year old and 2 year old and have never had a better time at a restaurant! The kids loved the food and the atmosphere. My husband and I loved the food! Can't wait to go back.

sFzWX0NGtU04wxX2fzE9mg.text: Great Hibachi! I had the 3 item special, chicken , filet and shrimp! The filet mignon was phenomenal! I called for take out, Peter was very polite and patient with me, being my first time ordering. He recommended the special which saved me money and  it was plenty of food for two of us. Yummy

I6Nm2PTnOmy12SekJEQe3g.text: Good time here at this location. The service, the food and the decor are all great. The only drawback is that the main door to the men and women's restroom (not the door to the restroom itself) is located right next to one of the hibachi stations.  One other bit of information. When you the chef is cooking all the food, listen to what other people are requesting to be done to the food. For example, someone requested well seasoned food, but you don't want well seasoned. Make sure the chef understands that request of both of you.

3-W6I3kkJiN0yS37aRJIig.text: Chef Von makes our experience great. He's not cheesy. He's so funny. Super cute. The food is fresh and the salad dressing is amazing. I'm never going back to Benihana again. This place is so much better tasting and so much better pricing!!!!

N9JgqAxs4v4upftJhsK_Nw.text: Hands down best hibachi in Vegas that isn't on the strip. Prices are very affordable with large portions. Cuts of steak and veggies were fresh and the staff including the owner were extremely attentive and accommodating. Will return here again when back in LV!

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p-xYk2gWKv8H-qex4l1wkw.text: DELICIOUS!!  Really great meal here that started with the sparkling sake with white peach. Yum!! It could have easily been too sweet but it wasn't.    We started with a spicy tuna roll and that was also really good. And of course the hibachi - perfection. Filet, shrimp, scallops - all great.   We loved it and will be back the next time we're in Vegas!

Tp9zb9yvqh4779vKJBrFrQ.text: I want to start by saying this was our favorite restaurant and the only one we've bragged about.  Tonight was my 50th birthday and we'd been telling our friends how much we love Ohjah so we went there.  This is now the second time I've taken visitors to Ohjah to be embarrassed not only for us, but their business.  Our cook "Michael" didn't talk to any of us or do ANYTHING regarding teppanyaki skills, he only did a choo choo whistle thing at a strange time.  When he got to the shrimp throwing part he was tossing shrimp a foot over our head or under so it was uncatchable, it was very uncomfortable quite honestly.  I know this seems silly, but when you're watching other cooks doing it correctly you feel jipped.  I'm very disappointed in Ohjah for even allowing this amateur to "entertain" and cook for our group.

sTqR2uYxITOXq2B0-UYVoQ.text: I wish I could give this place 2.5 stars, but I'll give it 3 because it doesn't deserve a flat 2. As soon as we arrived, the host skipped us and went to a group of guests that arrived after us. No biggie, but we sat down and realized that it was hot as a sauna. We asked them to turn down the air but it remained a steamy cesspool of sweat and spice throughout our meal. The server confused our drinks a few times, again no biggie. But the main course came out before my appetizer, and my spicy beef had two bones in it. Nothing like killing your appetite trying to bite into a crunchy bone. The food tasted decent, but nothing great. The combination of meh service, extreme heat, and bones just killed it for me. Might have just come on off night but this was massively disappointing for all the good reviews I've read.

0t6msrENnwevXDH8pUAtkg.text: Love coming here always a hit ....service is always very attentive weekend are usually busy and they don't seat you in till your whole party is there so come together

5Ef4jqd0ExLyw4rtJYKzEA.text: I love coming here now. Customer service has gotten better. The fish is fresh. Go sit at the sushi bar and ask for chef Larry. Let him surprise you with his creations.

Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special roll
Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special sashimi made by Larry

z0wCBGJ0RkEGw7bp_2-SJA.text: Absolutely fantastic food, great service and reasonable prices.  Had the vegetable Pad Thai and it was amazing.

9Y8JABeNBM1sOPQYloO3fw.text: WOO HOO for Habachi!!! Yo I have had my fair share of teppanyaki and Ohjah serves up a pretty good one. Now I know some of you might not find this too exciting but forget all that if you would to have a go to local habachi or sushi steak house here it is. I have to say this location didn't seem or look like it has a big enough space inside for this but it did. Located next to Lee's Liquor and Papa Murphy pizza it also doesn't look like there is much parking. But have no fear there is plenty on the side and in back.   Upon entering you will find yourself in the restaurant/sushi bar side. They have a completely separate room for habachi next door. Our service girl was nice and the chef was really entertaining, I was very stoke we got the guy we did because the cook before him didn't look like he wasn't having such a great night. We came here for my Birthday celebration and everyone got a mix plate and I ordered the Ohjah Boat with sashimi, special sushi rolls, nigiri and seaweed salad.  The lobster, filet and shrimp teppanyaki was cooked and seasoned so perfectly. Meat was tender...not dried and tough like (Benihana's) and the shrimp and lobsters had great texture as well not chewy or fishy. The fried rice was yummy very garlicy just how I like it. I also got the Sushi and Shashimi boat for myself. Which is pretty awesome and more then enough food! come with 3 specialty sushi rolls of your choice and 10 pcs of nigeri 6 pcs of shashimi and a side of seaweed salad. BOMB!  All in all I loved this place and will be back and how cool is getting your sushi served on a freaking Boat Man?!?!.....Super cool!

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster
Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My bday cheese cake
Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi and shashimi boat

DMO0IPg64SlaBV3XOvSZjg.text: This place is typical Japanese Hibachi restaurant. I have dined at Hibachi probably over 100x in my life and this was probably my least favorite time.  The cook had zero interaction and did about 1/10 of the tricks that they normally do. Maybe next time we will go to another place.

96eJcCJTTD2d8CeY3p4jZg.text: This is definitely the best place in Vegas to get Teppanyaki my only wish is that they had white sauce to go with everything and it would be game over for everyone and their weight.

-vWeNG91NY3mzj8qQW2Pww.text: First time finally trying this place out and I regret not coming here sooner, I'm so impressed! We ordered Beef Negimaki for our appetizer which was incredibly tender and full of flavor. I would come back just for this alone. I ordered the hibachi noodles with Filet mignon, which I was please to surprised it included the hibachi veggies, and salad and soup. Soup was so-so but the salad... Wow so simple yet so wonderful, something about the dressing you can't find anywhere else. My steak was cooked medium TO PERFECTION! I've been to fine dining steak houses that weren't as good and tender as this! My husband orders the fried rice (which I kept steeling, the scallops, and the chicken. The chicken was probably my least favorite, flavorful but a tad over cooked... I'll stick to my filet mignon. Great place to bring out of town guests, This place is great for birthdays too. We will be back!

qKN3chPKAqPH_szocD5HSQ.text: I have been here numerous times for the hibachi & restaurant side dining. The hibachi here is so delicious & every chef is so entertaining & personable. They do all the standard hibachi tricks but also new ones every once in a while. Our last chef said he youtubes videos, so you know they take pride in their work. The restaurant food is also delicious, they serve sukiyaki which is hard to find & love their sushi rolls. Make a reservation for hibachi for sure bc it's always packed. The restaurant side mid week is fine for walk ins but make a reservation for weekends. I have a large family so I always call for a reservation even if we're already on our way to make things easier.

y8YbknI3sca5ZDslZro79A.text: Ok, My wife is vegetarian now so our dining options are kinda limited ( I know there are options, but that knocks out ALL of my burger joints.. LOL)  So, we drive my Ohjah literally every day and wanted to try it out. We were very pleasantly surprised. The service was very good and the young lady that helped us was great. Even the owner ( or just a very official looking gentleman) came by our table.   We didn't do the Teppan Yaki so we sat at a regular table. The atmosphere is very nice and the restaurant is very clean. We got some vegetarian sushi rolls ( avocado and Asparagus tempura) that my wife LOVED. I tried them and they were very good. I got a simple california Roll and it was great too. She got vegetarian Fried Rice that was very fresh tasting with crisp sauteed vegetables. It was great. I got the New York Steak Teriyaki. It was good. We even got dessert ( Mochi and tempura Ice Cream).  Its very nice to have a good dining establishment in the Neighborhood. We will frequent Ohjah often.

qNKYdRkkWSXTYGFkH6SBBg.text: What a great restaurant. I went with my boyfriend for our anniversary, the chef was amazing and the food was even better. The customer service was exceptional, the waiters came to pick up our trash and plates while we ate so we wouldn't have a mess and refilled our glasses constantly.

pqqjpBpwp6VLmTVwdD7Aqw.text: This a great neighborhood Japanese joint.  Not the best, not the worst, but always solid.  I've been here enough that I found certain staples that I always get:  Garlic Edamame, Japanese Spring Rolls, Soft Shell Crab, SOB roll...There is also very delicious Hibachi here.

7EowlRHMRu8A0zn7hT79fA.text: Picture this - Sea World and the dolphins are doing funny things to the sound of a whistle. Now flash forward to this eatery - minus the dolphins...it is the same thing. A group of people are seated around a grill in which the "trainer" or chef makes noises with utensils and then flips food into mouths of the people that pay $30 each to be treated like a sea lion and clap after being tossed a piece of shrimp.   Excitement level - crazy weird. Not my thing, I would rather head to the real Sea World and laugh at the goofy dolphins and sea lions doing tricks for food than the Vegas elite...  Decent food though...

PX-1xTmfgyGL2cH8jUTRhQ.text: Wow! Service was awesome.  Food was great.   Most importantly, kids loved it.  Free hot sake with a yelp check in so i had to pair that with a draft Sapporo which was literally ice cold!  I had the sashimi salad - fish was fresh topped with roe and amazing dressing with just the right kick of spiciness.    Kids had the chicken teriyaki,  beef yakisoba.  Quality was great.    My lover had spicy beef -adorned with shrooms, peppers, and carrots.  The beef were chunks of steak.  Pricing is reasonable and we left with to-go boxes.  Oh and they had good boba.

j-OTiOtnNFz4R5TurT5QUg.text: Took my niece nephew and son here. The kids liked it. Food was pretty good, up to par with the rest of these type of places. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I'd like to come here with friends next time have some drinks and a fun night. I would recommend this place.

eLfunmhgXSpzX_W7qf2VXw.text: I usually go there have sushi. I went there to have late lunch with my friend. We had ohjah boat with my favorite rolls(dark cycle, cowboy, gentlemen's club). Very good price, 3 rolls were very tasty and sashimi was fresh. Service is always good. I always go there to have sushi. Haven't tried hibachi yet... Hibachi area is always busy. I will try hibachi next time for sure.

RFkQQFyBgj8USFx2jiQNBA.text: As a sushi fan on a budget, this place hit the spot. Attentive but not overbearing staff turn out plates of sushi faster than you can fill your sake cup. Pages of special rolls that go beyond the typical Philly Roll and Spider Roll.   We ordered the Bonsai Dinner which included:   *2 Special Rolls - Thumbs up for the Widow and Kamikaze Roll (smoked salmon? heavenly.) *TEN! pieces of Nigiri- no substitutions from the menu but the chef gave us top notch fishies *Seaweed Salad   Along with a large Asahi and hot sake our bill was under $60. A much better deal than the ever increasing prices of All-You-Can-Eat on every corner of this sinful city.

PZGNdTqkScvKkIGigLjV0g.text: I always have to order the King Salmon roll, probably one of the best rolls I've tasted in years!  Everything else is pretty good, but this roll to me is magic.

JT1v_dGUn-iWqpzbKiCdsg.text: I really enjoyed the food here. We ate hibachi. My lobster tail was amazing! The scallops were really good too. I'm craving it now haha! Was a very good first experience. I always see this place driving blue diamond. Glad that I gave it a try. Will have to do sushi next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So yummy! Scallops, lobster tail, filet minion, and calamari.

7jYVR0vS8lmh_aPJcIn9ug.text: It was ok but nothing special. I had the New York steak which had a lot of fat in it. My friend had the chicken and said it was really good.  My water was empty for some time and I saw the server in the corner chatting with another server. I finally gave up and refilled the water on my own.  I won't be back.

A3ZQYXaJFNzIvjCs8AysYQ.text: This is my favorite teppenyaki place in Vegas. They have great prices, delicious sushi selection and fantastic, attentive service. We used to frequent ohjah about once a week, but it got pricey.   You can order the main teppenyaki dish for $8.95 and then add on your meat selection, whether it is filet or shrimp or both.   The salad dressing is to die for... I wish I could just drink it. Their sushi is so fresh And they have a great assortment of rolls.   Definitely will be back soon!

WHYKNQ8tdi2tYi4ggRyAPw.text: I've been to several tepinyaki places and there is nothing that stands out about this place so much. Everything is al a carte which kinda threw me off at first, but actually it works out for me. I don't eat the veggies and soup so I'm just interested in the fried rice and meat. It was good, but not the best I've had. The service was great though.

ZBQuiZVXAb2pcFfRiUBj7w.text: The ambiance is beautiful! The server, Doson, was absolutely polite, efficient, attentive and friendly! Thechef was funny and cooked our dinner in record time. Our 8 year old son was very entertained and enjoyed his filet meal!!  Would suggest filet with shrimp from the tempanyaki grill. Love this place!!

JibKtjl2jEkGDZlpCcCk8w.text: The best sushi place in Vegas! We like to get the ohjah boat. It's amazing! $50 with three rolls, sashimi, and nigiri. The fish is always fresh. Service is excellent! We will definitely be back again and again!

rDq3B-FI5qGM6b4CFBTcvg.text: Love the hibachi grill service...however at times the additional parties you are sat with can be ignorant or have no class --- causing the experience not to be a pleasant one, but overall I have dined here several times and will be back.  Bring your own group if possible

o6ZZ6FTN2CZko1rJqRnfbg.text: So delicious and amazing prices! Half the price of Geisha House. The music is extremely soothing. Love the place and will go back often.

COYawo-JSuYoGySKGCbx1A.text: I love this place! The owner always remembers us and welcomes us with a smile, even though we have a 2 year old who came sometimes be rambunctious. I have only come for sushi, but want to try the teppan yaki one day. Try the "you and me" "pink lady" rolls. So yummy! Make sure you get the buy two, get one free discount.

9iWvl9vzRsSiEvF8QJqZIw.text: We couldn't even eat here.... I mean really!! The guy at the front said that since we didn't make reservations we couldn't eat there. Maybe we didn't understand his broken English..... He said "to eat you need reservation"..... I didn't know I was going to be off work tonight.... It was a spur of the moment date night with the husband.... And we were refused service!!!! I won't be going back!!

eGH0XPgMcsA0O30n_Eny4g.text: Ohjah is amazing! Better than benihanas and much cheaper! $40 for two people, when its nearly 80-100 at benihanas. I love their fried rice so much flavor, I honestly love everything about this place and I recommend it to everyone.   I go here about 2-4 times a week which is ridiculous!!! STOP CONTEMPLATING JUST GO!

LtOU8Lyh3NnaP8W6o7EdOA.text: Tonight's dinner at the Sushi bar was INCREDIBLE. We had California Roll, Dragon Roll, Rock and Roll and Lobster Roll. It was positively sex on a plate. I will eat here 100 times more. The sushi here will leave you begging for mercy!

g-upckIbbkunswzxmnpxpQ.text: The food is always fresh and good quality!  The only complaint I have, is there are "surprise" ingredients in things that I wouldn't expect.   A dish my boyfriend orders all the time suddenly had mushrooms in it.   The Tom Yum had an INSANE amount of bamboo and no other ingredients except for mushrooms and the shrimp (I ordered Shrimp Tom Yum).  BUT the sushi is fantastic and the teppanyaki is very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll!
Photo of Ohjah Japanese Steakhouse Sushi & Hibachi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kKKL5a_EkKzJ7xB3aKymFg.text: This is one of our staple restaurants. There isn't usually a wait, but it does get busy and lively. We haven't tried the hibachi yet, but are looking forward to it.   The miso soup is good, and because I'm pregnant I haven't tried too much sushi. I did get a tempura shrimp roll once and was disappointed that the batter was soggy instead of crunchy. However, I recently had the shrimp tempura entree, and it was dynamite, so they clearly can make a mean tempura if they want. The tempura dipping sauce was a little bland. Many of their sushi specialty rolls tend to be on the hot side rather than sweet. I usually don't eat California rolls, but my husband did the other day, and it was the best CA roll I've ever had. It left me scratching my head wondering how a CA roll could be so good.  Their teriyaki is pretty good. Sometimes the chicken is dry, but the New York steak is consistently good, and tender for NY. They reportedly make their own teriyaki sauce, and do not use MSG, huge plus.  As for sides, their rice can be inconsistent, but their salads have good dressing and are pretty darn good for iceberg lettuce.  The service is decent, but there are some new servers who do things like put the food on the middle or end of the table instead of in front of the person who ordered it. Usually not a biggie, unless its hot soup they put in front of a young child...  That aside, it's one of our favorite "regular" places.

viuHWw2n8N-7AKM6TXuvGA.text: This is a very good hibachi place and the prices are cheap! Just for chicken it is $13.25 and for shrimp it is $13.95. Service is nice and even the sushi is good.  PROS: Food, Price, Service CONS: Gets packed on weekends (long waits)

zH3OtUDEgaV50YlzUnF2cg.text: Service was excellent and the prices are great....but the food quality was lacking a little. Went here to celebrate a friend's birthday dinner and my salmon was over cooked. Also the rice wasn't as fluffy as it should be. Maybe next time we will just sit at the sushi bar...

LiWFrNZj6JQwk28TVIbwaA.text: Visited this place, which I recently noticed off of Blue Diamond Rd, and I was sure glad I did. Although I was not very hungry when I visited, the service was very friendly and food was fresh. I came here with my fellow yelper Al, and our gyoza, california roll and chicken katsu was worth returning for.   Their menu includes other dishes besides sushi, and they also offer a hibachi grill side of the restaurant which looks very nice....and very affordable. I will certainly visit them again.

vQdytaA_P2v06Ex3biXYTA.text: 3.5 stars  Ohjah doesn't rise nor sinks when compared to other Japanese restaurants, they just provide decent food with good service. Their sushi reflected that mayonaise, rice, and raw fish do not bode well together. Our party ordered three rolls but it was difficult to distinguish which was which. Each was slammed with 10 lbs. of spicy mayo and sweet eel sauce over flavorless spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, avocado, and/or cream cheese. Maybe we ordered the wrong things, but the phrase, "Which roll is this again?" was spouted during the course of the meal.   If there was a shining light in the meal, it was my hot entree. I actually enjoyed my spicy chicken. They were generous with their meat, the veggies were cooked perfectly, and it came with soup and salad. However, they should omit spicy from the description. It was more sweet and salty. I asked for extra spice but instead got an extra layer of red sauce. Other parts of the meal included a well excuted tempura. In the end, they gave pre-packaged hand cloths to wipe away all the grime and residue of your greasy claws. They have a hibachi grill if you want entertainment and flames. The atmosphere evokes dark and romantic but the clienteles are big-ass families with waistlines that match.

MQxXL_OV932_aNaoh4C1OA.text: After a genuine message from the owner after my review - we decided to give this place one more chance.    Came in last night and opted for the dining area instead of the hibachi room.  Service was a HUGE improvement from my last visit.    Only Downfalls:  - they charged us for an extra order of edamame - not going to complain over $3  - they charge $1 extra per roll to sub. soy paper  We will be back thanks to Saly & Peter to give the Hibachi room another shot as well.

r65fyH7bPt-5ULjVwS1s7w.text: Went for the first time and did the hibachi and it was amazing! I'm a really picky eater and thought it was soooo good! The onion soup is so yummy and so was the fried rice, chicken teriyaki, and filet minion! Delicious!! Definitely recommend (even if you don't eat sushi like myself)

4h6sdpHURIbwywSbskQSrA.text: Fantastic!  That's all I can say.  Will be back for sure.  Close to home. So no fighting The Strip traffic. Good, better, great, awesome.  Everything was super for sure.

B7kE3vFu1pj1nXk-KOuAhg.text: Fresh sashimi clean presentations.   Came here with a $20 certificate so we decided to go big and order the boat. This was a pretty good deal as it included 3 specialty rolls, salmon, ahi tuna, and hamachi sashimi, seaweed salad, and three types tobico for only $45. Just the specialty rolls were $10 - $12 each so it was well worth it. We also ordered the lychee Saki, they had a few different kinds of flavored Saki which are good for those don't like the original flavor of Saki. We were told the boat would take about 15 min but they served us each an order of the house salad as we wait.   When the boat came out I was very impressed by the presentation. The specialty rolls were OK, but what put the boat over the top was the slices of sashimi. Each slice was about half and inch thick with about 3-4 slices each. The quality of the fish was superb and with each bite you certainly can taste the freshness. In my mind what differentiates a lot of these sushi restaurants is the quality and freshness of their fish. Ohjah certainly displays fresh quality ingredients.   I would love to come back and try their Hibachi. But would definitely come back for their sashimi.

fZxWY2uZnFalCo1FmqYE8Q.text: In my opinon this is the best Hibachi grill for the price in town. The food is always fresh and my g/f loves the cheap Sake! Enough said! I always tell everybody that they should make reservations because they are always busy. In fact I just made one just now for 7pm!

JpIMdJX8nqdP-ifHNm0ZNg.text: Terrific hibachi, among the best I've ever had.  Or maybe I was just really, really hungry.  Either way, I'll definitely be going back sometime.

LiXk0CKO7s4SXLeGHyiNIw.text: I took my brother in law here for his 21st birthday. I was a couple days late, I couldn't get off work during week.  But we called on way to restaurant and made quick reservations. We get there and instantly seated. I been waiting to try the hibachi for 1st and 2nd time here and our timing was off, but this time we were in.  So we started with some sake, our salad and onion soup which are both very good! The salad is my favorite. I gave up rice for lent so fried noodles it is. The fried noodle was very good!  I got the combo with 3 choices. I got scallops, filet mignon, and shrimp. I got this the very first time we can here but no hibachi show, it was lunch time. Food was 5 stars on its own.   Next our show, I forgot his name we had a couple bottles of sake. I guess we were waiting for more people for our table and they were very late and gave us complimentary edamame on the house while we waited. Very nice of them. Our show was the very fun! We all caught shrimp in our mouth. We had a blast, the price was right. Great food, service, fun. We will back soon, thank you Ohjah.

9nG5Y1q3E7Fn_5NfwhvO3Q.text: Dynamite roll is just that-dynamite! The Sushi was off the charts delicious and the service was terrific also. I was also happy to see that Hibachi dining was available which is always a plus when you've got kids (I don't, but my friends do). I've been here twice-once at the Sushi Bar and once at the Hibachi table; both offered great food, good service and a reason to come back.

yiO6Ydn6u3q-PBgs8Q6Teg.text: LOVE Ohjah. Staff is extraordinary and chefs amazing. We come here as often as we can to take advantage of the deliciousness. The wait staff even recognizes my 4-year-old daughter whenever we are here, which makes her experience even better.

hxfn3YR1aETlL9GylUWx-A.text: Excited and drove far out because it's opening 5 minutes by our house. Expectations weren't met:( so sad about about it. Fried rice lacks flavor does not compare to Hokkaido, Hamada, Benihana and Hikari. Do not order halibut, came with 5 bones:(((... And chef over cooked:( concept of add on good but failed to execute and quite pricey after all. Service not great but not worth coming back.

2ttcAX7uIJDnRt1Lvmgjzw.text: The sushi and service are consistently very good.  I always order the rainbow roll when I get sushi - for two reasons: it's my favorite and it allows me to compares restaurants. Their rainbow roll ranks well.  They just need a happy hour, or at least specials on Sake!

QL69OrF0eyncDSoQ9zz2lg.text: Amazing food, amazing service.... You can't go wrong with hibachi. Bar only has beer, wine and Japanese drinks.

7hdX0BbrFF4xSHC56np48A.text: This used to be my favorite restaurant. Still pretty good but I miss there lunch time specials.

5Bhd-GC5FTCnY2eBQwBWPA.text: Burnt New York steak in 10 minutes of me going to pick up and some how over cooked crab in spider roll. Falling apart as I get them home and to top it all off obviously since I'm some white guy i don't use chopsticks to eat sushi they throw plastic forks in the bag for me . Thanks! NEVER AGAIN

On7bQo0f_zr9s7-my37J4Q.text: Great quality with great price.  Their dishes are more fusion Japanese than traditional, but I enjoyed it.  Sashimi grades are excellent
